text: "The wise man asks questions of himself; the fool questions others."
"Penny wise and pound foolish."
"When the fool knows when to be silent, he would be sitting among the wise."
"Wise men philosophize as the fools live on."
"Useless wisdom is double foolishness."
"What use is wisdom when folly reigns?"
"The wise man says what he knows; the fool doesn’t know what he is saying."
"When a fool has the cow by the horns, the wise man can milk it."
"In the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges and the foolish build dams."
"A foolish fox is caught by one leg, but a wise one by all four."
"Boasting begins where wisdom stops."
"Were fools silent, they would pass for wise."
"A fool says what he knows, and a wise man knows what he says."
"Wisdom is born; stupidity is learned."
"A spoon does not know the taste of soup, nor a learned fool the taste of wisdom."
"What a fool does in the end, the wise man does in the beginning."
"Reason is the wise man’s guide, example the fool’s."
"Foolish boys, wise men."
"Even from a foe a man may learn wisdom."
"It is a wise man who lives with money in the bank, it is a fool who dies that way."
"Be wise, but pretend to be ignorant."
"What wise men suppose is worth more than the certainties of fools."
"The believer is happy; the doubter is wise."
"We start as fools and become wise through experience."
"A wise man will not rebuke a fool."
"Fools build houses, and wise men buy them."
"A wise man changes his mind, a fool never will."
"A fool by chance may say a wise thing."
"To the world wisdom is folly; to the wise the world is foolish."
"A fool can ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years."
"Men can acquire knowledge, but not wisdom. Some of the greatest fools ever known were learned men."
"The fool has to do at last what the wise did at first."
"A wise man’s day is worth a fool’s life."
"The fool sings a love song to his wife, the wise man will talk about his dog."
"For a wise man a fool is a good advisor."
"As the wise man looks for a bridge the fool crosses the river."
"The foolish sayings of a rich man pass for wise ones."
"The wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool does from his friends."
"Riches serve a wise man but command a fool."
"The wise man says "I am looking for truth"; and the fool, "I have found truth.""
"The hot sun melts away the snow; when anger comes, does wisdom go."
"He that’s a wise man by day is no fool by night."
"Better a wise man’s servant than an idiot’s master."
"A fool who can keep silent is counted among the wise."
"One idiot can ask more questions than ten wise men can answer."
"When a hundred men call a wise man a fool, then he becomes a fool."
"The wise understand; fools follow the reports of others."
"The fool speaks, the wise man listens."
"There is no wise response to a foolish remark."
"The speaker may well be a fool but the listener is wise."
"The wise man, even when he holds his tongue, says more than the fool when he speaks."
"A miser’s money takes the place of wisdom."
"What a fool can spoil, ten wise men cannot repair."
"Better a slap from a wise man than a kiss from a fool."
"It is better to weep with wise men than to laugh with fools."
"He alone is wise who can accommodate himself to all contingencies of life; but the fool contends, and struggling, like a swimmer, against the stream."
"No woman can make a wise man out of a fool, but every woman can change a wise man into a fool."
"A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything."
"Everyone is wise until he speaks."
"A fool is a wise man’s ladder."
"It is better to be in hell with a wise man than in heaven with an idiot."
"The wise man is father of the fool."
"The biggest fools are those who are paid to be wise."
"Sooner or later the truth comes to light."
"Pay me back what you owe me; we’ll talk later about what I owe you."
"If you are looking for bad luck, you will soon find it."
"A building without foundation is soon demolished."
"He who does not mend his clothes will soon have none."
"Have patience, the grass will be milk soon enough."
"Care now, be cared for later."
"Who does not beat his own child will later beat his own breast."
"The longest day soon comes to an end."
"Everybody sooner or later has to drop the luggage and the baggage of illusions."
"We all end up in a single bed sooner or later."
"What you save is, later, like something found."
"Enjoy yourself. It’s later than you think."
"No sooner is a law made than a way around it is discovered."
"What flares up fast, extinguishes soon."
"Soon learned, soon forgotten."
"Long absent, soon forgotten."
"It is never later than midnight."
"Ingratitude is sooner or later fatal to its author."
"Soon enough is well enough."
"He that always thinks it is too soon is sure to come too late."
"Sooner or later the day comes when the tumor can be lanced."
"Death is a black camel that lies down at every door. Sooner or later you must ride the camel."
"As soon as man is born he begins to die."
"Better reap two days too soon than one too late."
"Soon grass, soon hay."
"Only believe a woman one day later."
"A marriage in later years sends a letter to the grave digger."
"As soon as a man leaves his house he has seven enemies."
"He who buys useless things, later sells things that he needs."
"Look for the good and let the bad things come on their own."
"March comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb."
"The cuckoo comes in April, and stays the month of May; sings a song at midsummer, and then goes away."
"The bucket goes down the well every day — some day it won’t come up again."
"We come and cry and that is life, we cry and go and that is death."
"Prayers go up and blessings come down."
"Gold that is lent goes away laughing and comes back in tears."
"What comes from the fife goes back to the drum."
"Don’t ask me where I am going but where I have come from."
"Deficiencies come by the kilo and go by the gram."
"A mule can go to Mecca, but it will not come back as a pilgrim."
"Blessed is the moon; it goes but it comes back again."
"If the wine comes in, good sense goes out."
"If the mountain will not come to Mahomet, Mahomet must go to the mountain."
"No matter how long the night, the day is sure to come."
"Easy come, easy go."
"It is often more difficult to come back home than it is to go away."
"When its time has come, the prey goes to the hunter."
"Rain, rain, go away, come again another day."
"Let go over a cliff, die completely, and then come back to life — after that you cannot be deceived."
"When hard work goes out of the door, poverty comes in at the window."
"God is looking for those who come to Him."
"When the cat is gone, the mice come out to stretch."
"As one devil goes out, another one comes in."
"A day to come seems longer than a year that’s gone."
"If the mule doesn’t go to the burden, then the burden will come to the mule."
"The devil goes away and heaven comes to stay."
"If a man becomes powerful even his chicken and his dog go to heaven."
"In a conclave many go in as a pope but come back out as the cardinal they were when they went in."
"Sickness comes on horseback, but goes away on foot."
"The hot sun melts away the snow; when anger comes, does wisdom go."
"What comes out of one mouth goes into a hundred others."
"The tail of an ox says, "Time goes, time comes.""
"With a full belly it is easy to talk about fasting."
"Wisdom is easy to carry but difficult to gather."
"To be human is easy; to be a human being is difficult."
"To criticize is easy, to do is difficult."
"It is easy to get a thousand soldiers, but difficult to get one general."
"It is easy to be born; it is difficult to be a human being."
"Laughing is not always the proof of a mind at ease."
"It is difficult to find a man but it’s easy to recognize him."
"Talking is easy, action is difficult."
"Happiness opens the arms and closes the eyes."
"Arm ourselves for war? No! All the arms we need are for hugging."
"The master has long arms, but they don’t reach heaven."
"It is impossible to bend the arm of God."
"God gives nothing to those who keep their arms crossed."
"Two watermelons cannot be held under one arm."
"What worth has beauty if it is not seen?"
"Beauty doesn’t exist, men only dream it."
"A heart in love with beauty never grows old."
"Whoever I love is the most beautiful."
"If there is light in the soul, there will be beauty in the person. If there is beauty in the person, there will be harmony in the house."
"Beauty, unaccompanied by virtue, is as a flower without perfume."
"A poor beauty finds more lovers than husbands."
"A good character is real beauty that never fades."
"Beauty is a good letter of introduction."
"Beauty is power."
"Without grace beauty is an unabated hook."
"Beauty never travels in a group."
"Beauty is ten, nine of which is dressing."
"Beauty is the wisdom of women. Wisdom is the beauty of men."
"A beautiful person might not have a beautiful life."
"If you want to take revenge on a man, send him a really beautiful woman."
"A beautiful thing is never perfect."
"A beautiful woman belongs to everyone; an ugly one is yours alone."
"Beautiful roads never go far."
"Beauty is the eye’s food but the soul’s sorrow."
"Beauty without honesty is like a rose without perfume."
"Old canoes can be restored, but youth and beauty cannot."
"Beautiful girls are seldom happy, intelligent boys are seldom beautiful."
"He who marries a beauty marries trouble."
"Your best mirror is someone more beautiful than you."
"Even the most beautiful morning cannot bring back the evening."
"Good health is the sister of beauty."
"A woman gets thirty percent of her beauty from nature and seventy percent from makeup."
"If God didn’t like beautiful women, he wouldn’t have made them."
"The beauty of a woman does not make a man richer."
"Beauty is silent eloquence."
"Your beauty is in what you have."
"The beautiful is less what one sees than what one dreams."
"Time has no respect for beauty."
"She who is born a beauty is born betrothed."
"Beauty is the sister of idleness and the mother of luxury."
"What is good is not necessarily beautiful."
"What you love is always beautiful."
"A beautiful face is admired even when its owner doesn’t say anything."
"Charm is stronger than beauty."
"Tell a woman once she is beautiful and the devil will repeat it ten times."
"Rare is agreement between beauty and modesty."
"Beauty is only skin deep."
"Women are as beautiful as flowers when they are forty years old."
"A beautiful wife without money is like a fine house without furniture."
"Beautiful woman, beautiful trouble."
"A beetle is a beauty in the eyes of his mother."
"Thousands of men were murdered because of their beautiful wives."
"Where the hostess is beautiful the wine is tasty."
"When a beautiful woman does not steal, she takes you."
"Anyone who sees beauty and does not look at it will soon be poor."
"A face that never laughs betrays an evil heart."
"Better a red face than a black heart."
"A brave man is scared of a lion three times: first when he sees the tracks; second when he hears the first roar; and third when they are face to face."
"A letter from the heart can be read on the face."
"To know another is not to know that person’s face, but to know that person’s heart."
"Easy to know men’s faces, not their hearts."
"Sorrow is better than laughter, for by the sadness of the face the heart is made better."
"The face is no index to the heart."
"For news of the heart ask the face."
"Though talking face to face, their hearts are a thousand miles apart."
"A smile is the light in the window of your face that tells people you’re at home."
"I’ve never seen a smiling face that was not beautiful."
"The most important thing you wear is the expression on your face."
"Better to see the face than to hear the name."
"The person with burned fingers asks for tongs."
"Without fingers the hand would be a spoon."
"I may have lost the ring, but I still have the fingers!"
"He who has long fingers should also have long legs."
"Offer a clown your finger, and he’ll take your fist."
"When you show the moon to a child, it sees only your finger."
"Never burn your fingers to snuff another man’s candle."
"When you point your finger at someone, look where the other fingers point."
"Man cannot stir one inch without the push of heaven’s finger."
"Five fingers are brothers but not equals."
"No one puts his finger back where it was once bitten."
"A single finger cannot catch fleas."
"You can’t hide behind your finger."
"Unfortunate is the man who has no fingernails to scratch his head with."
"After shaking hands with a Greek, count your fingers."
"Don’t use your teeth when you can untie the knot with your fingers."
"The tip of a finger cannot be touched by itself."
"One finger alone cannot even kill a louse."
"As the wound inflames the finger, so the thought inflames the mind."
"Better a friend at court than gold on the finger."
"Your fingers can’t be of the same length."
"He, who steals honey, licks his fingers."
"Never point out the mistakes of another with a dirty finger."
"Empty hands only please their owner."
"If the eyes didn’t see, the hands wouldn’t take."
"The devil takes a hand in what is done in haste."
"The eye sees, but the hand can’t reach."
"A thief has more than two hands."
"Put your hand in your conscience and see if it does not come out as black as pitch."
"You must judge a man by the work of his hands."
"There is no hand to catch time."
"Who takes the child by the hand, takes the mother by the heart."
"Where a man feels pain he lays his hand."
"If it were not for the hands, the clock would be useless."
"Long tongue — short hands."
"Golden hands, but a wicked mouth."
"The hand suffers at work, but the mouth still must eat."
"Lend everyone your ears, give a hand to your friends but give your lips only to a woman."
"When the hand ceases to scatter, the heart ceases to pray."
"Wash your hands often, your feet seldom, and your head never."
"The hands of a lawyer are always in someone’s pocket."
"A stone from the hand of a friend is an apple."
"A bit of fragrance always clings to the hand that gives you roses."
"Smooth hands love the labor of others."
"A lot will stick to dirty hands."
"The palm of your hand will not obscure the sun."
"Practice with the left hand while the right is still there."
"If one hand were the other they would both want to be clean."
"Take nothing in hand that may bring repentance."
"The scent of a rose will always stay on the hand of the giver."
"Many hands make light work."
"There is no nail varnish that can make old hands look younger."
"The world is in the hands of fools."
"The hand that gives is also the one that receives."
"Gloves hide the ugliest hands."
"With a piece of bread in your hand you’ll find paradise under a pine tree."
"One hand washes the other and both wash the face."
"It is hard to catch birds with an empty hand."
"Loose tongues are worse than wicked hands."
"Scatter with one hand, gather with two."
"You don’t milk a cow with your hands in your pockets."
"If life is fulfilled we go away with empty hands."
"The Tsar has three hands but only one ear."
"Hands that give also receive."
"A gentle hand may lead even an elephant by a single hair."
"You cannot climb a tree with one hand."
"Your hand is never the worse for doing its own work."
"You cannot applaud with one hand."
"Give cheerfully with one hand and you will gather well with two."
"Nothing wipes your tears away but your own hand."
"Kiss the hand that you cannot bite."
"A hand that is ready to hit may cause you great trouble."
"The hand that rocks the cradle rules the world."
"Use your enemy’s hand to catch a snake."
"Clapping with the right hand only will not make a noise."
"Brothers and sisters are as close as hands and feet."
"Don’t put it in my ear, but in my hand."
"You cannot carry two watermelons in one hand."
"Only the tent pitched by your own hands will stand."
"You cannot hold your head high with your hand out."
"No matter how dark it is, the hand always knows the way to the mouth."
"Be like the mouth and the hand: when the hand is hurt the mouth blows on it, when the mouth is hurt the hand rubs it."
"If a child washes his hands he could eat with kings."
"Every man goes down to his death bearing in his hands only that which he has given away."
"Hold your children with your heart but teach them with your hands."
"He who writes love letters must have clammy hands."
"He who has no hand cannot clench his fist."
"When one hand washes another, both become clean."
"There isn’t a sword that would cut off a golden hand."
"Promises have legs. Only a gift has hands."
"God gave us hands but He doesn’t build bridges with them."
"The hand of God is with the group."
"You can’t use your hand to force the sun to set."
"A flatterer has water in one hand and fire in the other."
"Kiss the hand of your enemy if you cannot chop it off."
"In the New Year, may your right hand always be stretched out in friendship, but never in want."
"Handfuls make a load."
"It needs a cunning hand to shave a fool’s head."
"Peace with a cudgel in hand is war."
"Don’t bite the hand that feeds you."
"Crawling on hands and knees has never prevented anyone from walking upright."
"Wash your hands in the flowing Ganges."
"It is better to have less thunder in the mouth and more lightning in the hand."
"Hold on to a true friend with both hands."
"Only what you have in your hand is not a lie."
"One hand can’t clap."
"Who has power in his hands has no need to lie; he uses violence."
"Adversity comes with instruction in his hand."
"A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush."
"The hand of the stranger is heavy."
"You cannot hide the sun with one hand."
"Snake at your feet – a stick at your hand!"
"Active hands, full bellies."
"A clean mouth and honest hand, will take a man through any land."
"Men will not be fortunate without a helping hand from misfortune."
"A hand that has been chopped off cannot steal any more."
"Two watermelons can’t be held in one hand."
"A smiling face dispels unhappiness."
"The teeth are smiling, but is the heart?"
"The smile of a rose uplifts the nightingale."
"Fortune will call at the smiling gate."
"A friend’s frown is better than a fool’s smile."
"A person without a smiling face must never open a shop."
"Every tear has a smile behind it."
"A smile shortens the distance."
"When a woman talks to you, smile but do not listen."
"One who smiles rather than rages is always the stronger."
"The teeth are smiling, but is the heart?"
"A smiling face is half the meal."
"Don’t trust the smile of your opponent."
"Priests even smile pleasantly on young women."
"People worry, and God smiles."
"If you have nothing else to offer me, offer me your smile."
"Smiles that you broadcast will always come back to you."
"All are not friends who smile at you."
"Patience begins with tears and ends with a smile."
"Every smile makes you a day younger."
"A smile is worth a thousand words."
"Never rely on the glory of the morning or the smiles of your mother-in-law."
"A smile will gain you ten more years of life."
"The main thing is that we can smile at our duties — yes even at our suffering."
"A tear at the right moment is better than a misplaced smile."
"Life is short but a smile takes barely a second."
"Instead of worrying, a strong man wears a smile."
"Smile… heaven is watching!"
"Once in each man’s life fortune smiles."
"The man who gives little with a smile gives more than the man who gives much with a frown."
"A smile costs nothing but gives much."
"A smile is a light in the window of the soul indicating that the heart is at home."
"It takes seventeen muscles to smile and forty-three to frown."
"A smile is something you can’t give away; it always comes back to you."
"A smile is a powerful weapon; you can even break ice with it."
"Every day you spend without a smile, is a lost day."
"Somewhere there’s someone who dreams of your smile, and finds in your presence that life is worth while. so when you are lonely, remember it’s true: somebody, somewhere is thinking of you."
"All people smile in the same language."
"If you would like to spoil the day for a grouch, give him a smile."
"Never frown…even when you’re sad ’cause you never know when someone’s falling in love with your smile."
"Some people grin and bear it; others smile and do it."
"My heart smiled when you kissed my lips."
"When you smile at someone, nine times out of 10 the other person will smile back and you’ve made two people’s days brighter and better."
"Love begins with a smile, grows with a kiss, and ends with a teardrop."
"By the way, i’m wearing the smile you gave me."
"Wear a smile … one size fits all."
"A smile can brighten the darkest day."
"A smile is a curve that sets everything straight."
"There are hundreds of languages in the world, but a smile speaks them all."
"People are not perfect, except when they smile."
"Remember me and smile, for it’s better to forget than remember me and cry."
"You haven’t lost your smile at all, it’s right under your nose. you just forgot it was there."
"The smile on your face lets me know that you need me, there’s a truth in your heart that says you’ll never leave me, and the touch of your hand says you’ll catch me whenever i fall."
"Smile; it’s the second best thing one can do with one’s lips."
"Smile, it lets your teeth breathe."
"It is almost impossible to smile on the outside without feeling better on the inside."
"You’ll find the smile more or less healing."
"When you smiled you had my undivided attention. when you laughed you had my urge to laugh with you. when you cried you had my urge to hold you. when you said you loved me, you had my heart forever."
"Smile – it increases your face value."

"Don’t go for the looks, it can be quite deceiving. don’t go for wealth, even that fades away — go for someone who makes you smile because only a smile makes a dark day seem bright. hope you find that person."
"It takes 26 muscles to smile, and 62 muscles to frown."
"Smiling is infectious, you can catch it like the flu. someone smiled at me today, and i started smiling too."
"Most smiles are started by another smile."
"A smile is an inexpensive way to change your looks."
"A friendly look, a kindly smile, one good act, and life’s worthwhile."
"I’ve never seen a smiling face that was not beautiful."
"Life is like a mirror, we get the best results when we smile at it."
"A winning smile makes winners of us all."
"A smile confuses an approaching frown."
"What prevents a man’s speaking good sense with a smile on his face?"
Smile — sunshine is good for your teeth."
"If you can smile when things go wrong, you have someone in mind to blame."
"Nobody knows it, but you’ve got a secret smile, and you use it only for me."
"If you don’t have a smile, i’ll give you one of mine."
"You can say no and smile only when there’s a bigger yes burning inside you."
"Leep smiling – it makes people wonder what you’ve been up to."
"If you smile at someone, they might smile back."
"If you don’t start out the day with a smile, it’s not too late to start practicing for tomorrow."
"You cannot strike a face that is smiling."
"A smile abroad is often a scowl at home.""
"It takes a lot of work from the face to let out a smile, but just think what good smiling can bring to the most important muscle of the body… the heart."
"I’ve never seen a smiling face that was not beautiful."
"The world always looks brighter from behind a smile."
"Look for a thing until you find it and you’ll not lose your labor."
"Seekers of art; finders of the beggar’s bag."
"Soon found, soon lost."
"All the treasures of the earth can’t bring back one lost moment."
"When the sea turned into honey, the poor man lost his spoon."
"Hearts, like thieves, never give back lost things."
"Wisdom is lost in a fat man’s body."
"Love is too rare to be lost on jealousy."
"He who carries nothing loses nothing."
"The ass went seeking for horns and lost his ears."
"All temptations are found in either hope or fear."
"Most insects are to be found near the blossoms."
"The very fact that we are looking for something usually stands in the way of our finding it."
"Art finds its food everywhere."
"Acorns were good till bread was found."
"We won the war, but lost peace."
"He who lost his faith, has nothing more to lose."
"The cow does not know the value of her tail till she has lost it."
"To have a woman is bad; to lose her is worse."
"He who lends to a friend loses twice."
"The day your horse dies and your money’s lost, your relatives change to strangers."
"A blind chicken will often find an ear of corn."
"One finds little ingratitude so long as one is in a position to grant favors."
"What you save is, later, like something found."
"There is no old bread that cannot find its cheese."
"A poor beauty finds more lovers than husbands."
"Count not what is lost but what is left."
"Win a cat and lose a cow — the consequence of litigation."
"Whoever lets himself be led by the heart will never lose his way."
"Virginity can be lost in one night."
"What has been blown away, cannot be found again."
"The new boat will find the old stones."
"Men who have lost heart never yet won a trophy."
"If you lend something you may lose it, but not if you give it."
"When a man finds no peace within himself, it is useless to look for it elsewhere."
"A day is lost if one has not laughed."
"Men never moan over the opportunities lost to do good, only the opportunities to be bad."
"When you can’t find peace within yourself, it’s useless to seek it elsewhere."
"Over the bottle many a friend is found."
"The tall one wouldn’t bend; the short one wouldn’t stretch and the kiss was lost."
"You can always find good elements in the misfortune that strikes you."
"Friends are lost by calling often and calling seldom."
"A good lie finds more believers than a bad truth."
"Often one finds one’s destiny just where one hides to avoid it."
"Those who lose dreaming are lost."
"A sleeping fox finds no meat."
"The pleasure of what we enjoy is lost by coveting more."
"The wise man says "I am looking for truth"; and the fool, "I have found truth.""
"He who has nothing to lose is rich."
"If you lose your wife and fifteen pennies — oh ! what a pity about the money."
"Truth is lost with too much debating."
"Better to ask twice than to lose your way once."
"What you lose in the fire, you will find amongest the ashes."
"Better a ruined than a lost land."
"Take heed you do not find what you do not seek."
"It’s by following his friends that a crab lost its hiding place."
"You cannot be lost on a road that is straight."
"All the fruit is not found in just one field."
"The woman who tells her age is either too young to have anything to lose or too old to have anything to gain."
"Only through suffering and sorrow do we acquire the wisdom not found in books."
"The best doctor is to be found in hell."
"You think you’ve lost yor horse? Who knows, he may bring a whole herd back to you someday."
"Seek and ye shall find."
"Woe is he who claims to have found happiness."
"When he looked under the saddle he lost his horse."
"Even the strongest person will find his master."
"Win your lawsuit and lose your money."
"The seeker is the finder."
"While wrangling over a quarter of pig, you can lose a flock of sheep."
"There’s many a good man to be found under a shabby hat."
"White flowers are not to be found in a coal sack."
"We do not know what is good until we have lost it."
"Once you have found your rhythm, you will then know your God."
"A red-nosed man may be a teetotaler, but will find no one to believe it."
"Many a friend has been lost by a jest, but none has ever been got by one."
"It’s no shame to look into the warm spring sun and regret a lost limb."
"Deviate an inch, lose a thousand miles."
"Hours once lost cannot be regained."
"Death is not found behind mountains but right behind our shoulders."
"You may find the worst enemy or best friend in yourself."
"I may have lost the ring, but I still have the fingers!"
"What comes out of the mouth has lost its master."
"Brains are not to be found in the beard."
"A bad workman never finds a good tool."
"A calf is not found under an ox."
"Profit is the brother of loss."
"Where profit is, loss is hiding nearby."
"It is difficult to scare people who think they will profit from dying."
"Accomplishment of purpose is better than making a profit."
"Better make profit out of manure than losses with musk."
"If there is any profit in partnership, two will share a woman."
"Stealing may bring profit, but hanging costs far more."
"There are only two things from which to choose: profit or loss."
"Moderate profits fill the purse."
"A man profits more by the sight of an idiot than by the orations of the learned."
"Cut your losses and let your profits run."
"Small profits are good if they come often."
"When there are two in a lawsuit only a third will profit from it."
"There is never trust without loss."
"When the tiger kills, the jackal profits."
"Whenever there is profit to be made then think of honesty."
"When a dead tree falls, the woodpeckers profit from his death."
"The fish sees the bait not the hook; a man sees not the danger — only the profit."
"Biggest profits mean gravest risks."
"Small profits and often, are better than large profits and seldom."
"Loaning money causes loss of memory."
"Adversity and loss make a man wise."
"A hundred years cannot repair a moment’s loss of honor."
"Whenever women say goodbye they always hang around for a while."
"Every goodbye is the birth of a memory."
"The wise man asks questions of himself; the fool questions others."
"Penny wise and pound foolish."
"When the fool knows when to be silent, he would be sitting among the wise."
"Wise men philosophize as the fools live on."
"Useless wisdom is double foolishness."
"What use is wisdom when folly reigns?"
"The wise man says what he knows; the fool doesn’t know what he is saying."
"When a fool has the cow by the horns, the wise man can milk it."
"In the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges and the foolish build dams."
"A foolish fox is caught by one leg, but a wise one by all four."
"Boasting begins where wisdom stops."
"Were fools silent, they would pass for wise."
"A fool says what he knows, and a wise man knows what he says."
"Wisdom is born; stupidity is learned."
"A spoon does not know the taste of soup, nor a learned fool the taste of wisdom."
"What a fool does in the end, the wise man does in the beginning."
"Reason is the wise man’s guide, example the fool’s."
"Foolish boys, wise men."
"Even from a foe a man may learn wisdom."
"It is a wise man who lives with money in the bank, it is a fool who dies that way."
"Be wise, but pretend to be ignorant."
"What wise men suppose is worth more than the certainties of fools."
"The believer is happy; the doubter is wise."
"We start as fools and become wise through experience."
"A wise man will not rebuke a fool."
"Fools build houses, and wise men buy them."
"A wise man changes his mind, a fool never will."
"A fool by chance may say a wise thing."
"To the world wisdom is folly; to the wise the world is foolish."
"A fool can ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years."
"Men can acquire knowledge, but not wisdom. Some of the greatest fools ever known were learned men."
"The fool has to do at last what the wise did at first."
"A wise man’s day is worth a fool’s life."
"The fool sings a love song to his wife, the wise man will talk about his dog."
"For a wise man a fool is a good advisor."
"As the wise man looks for a bridge the fool crosses the river."
"The foolish sayings of a rich man pass for wise ones."
"The wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool does from his friends."
"Riches serve a wise man but command a fool."
"The wise man says "I am looking for truth"; and the fool, "I have found truth.""
"The hot sun melts away the snow; when anger comes, does wisdom go."
"He that’s a wise man by day is no fool by night."
"Better a wise man’s servant than an idiot’s master."
"A fool who can keep silent is counted among the wise."
"One idiot can ask more questions than ten wise men can answer."
"When a hundred men call a wise man a fool, then he becomes a fool."
"The wise understand; fools follow the reports of others."
"The fool speaks, the wise man listens."
"There is no wise response to a foolish remark."
"The speaker may well be a fool but the listener is wise."
"The wise man, even when he holds his tongue, says more than the fool when he speaks."
"A miser’s money takes the place of wisdom."
"What a fool can spoil, ten wise men cannot repair."
"Better a slap from a wise man than a kiss from a fool."
"It is better to weep with wise men than to laugh with fools."
"He alone is wise who can accommodate himself to all contingencies of life; but the fool contends, and struggling, like a swimmer, against the stream."
"No woman can make a wise man out of a fool, but every woman can change a wise man into a fool."
"A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything."
"Everyone is wise until he speaks."
"A fool is a wise man’s ladder."
"It is better to be in hell with a wise man than in heaven with an idiot."
"The wise man is father of the fool."
"The biggest fools are those who are paid to be wise."
"Earth is but a marketplace; heaven is home."
"If you have a good cellar at home don’t go drinking at the tavern."
"Before preparing to improve the world, first look around your own home three times."
"God often visits us, but most of the time we are not at home."
"The lonely person is at home everywhere."
"He who wants to be happy must stay at home."
"If you love your son, make him leave home."
"If you’re going home, you don’t get wet."
"Away from home they look at your clothes. At home they look at what is under them."
"No one with a good catch of fish goes home by the back alley."
"He who travels a lot becomes wise; he who is wise stays home."
"If the dog is not at home, he barks not."
"Bricks and mortar make a house, but the laughter of children make a home."
"The sun at home warms better than the sun elsewhere."
"The wise traveler leaves his heart at home."
"It is often more difficult to come back home than it is to go away."
"Light your lamp first at home and after wards at the mosque."
"Rather free in a foreign place than a slave back home."

"If there is righteousness in the heart, there will be beauty in character. If there is beauty in character, there will be harmony in the home. If there is harmony in the home, there will be order in the nation. If there is order in the nation, there will."
"When we are at our happiest, then it is best to leave and go home."
"An Englishman’s home is his castle."
"Where there is no wife, there is no home."
"A woman’s place is in the home."
"If you stay at home you won’t wear out your shoes."
"Living is worthless for one without a home."
"Better than a banquet somewhere else is a good cup of tea and a bowl of rice at home."
"At home saints never perform miracles."
"Where I make my living, there is my home."
"A lonely person is at home everywhere."
"If an ass goes traveling it will not come home a horse."
"A home without a woman is like a barn without cattle."
"It is at home, not in public, that one washes his dirty linen."
"It is better to be a free man in a small house than a slave in a big one."
"The wise man and the tortoise travel but never leave their home."
"Not the place where I was born but where I hang my hat is home."
"On the road between the homes of friends, grass does not grow."
"Better be kind at home than burn incense in a far place."
"Although the snake does not fly it has caught the bird whose home is in the sky."

category: he longest road out is the shortest road home. ~ irish proverbs
he makes his home where the living is best. ~ latin proverbs

text: "Who asks at once for a lot, returns home with an empty bag."
"A king’s castle is his home."

category: you cannot buy wisdom abroad if there is none at home. ~ russian proverbs

text: "Abroad we judge the dress; at home we judge the man."
"The liar will travel the world over, but chooses not to go back home."
"Who knows the language is at home everywhere."
"Home is where you can say anything you like cause nobody listens to you anyway."
"There’s no place like home."
"Be a lion at home and a fox abroad."

category: every dog is a lion at home. ~ italian

text: "He who cannot pray at home will celebrate mass somewhere else."
"Better a stupid wife than a mess at home."
"A hundred men may make an encampment, but it takes a woman to make a home."
"East, west, home’s best."
"Aim high in your career but stay humble in your heart."
"Aiming isn’t hitting."
"Too aim is not enough, you must hit!"
"Before firing, you must take aim."
"Frivolous talk is like shooting without aiming."
"Achievement is largely the product of steadily raising one’s levels of aspirations and expectations."
"Accomplishment of purpose is better than making a profit."
"Greatness is not achieved with violence."
"An accomplishment sticks to a person."
"Whatever accomplishment you boast of in the world, there is someone better than you."
"God’s goal will be achieved when everyone is content with himself."
"Who begins too much accomplishes little."
"Not much is achieved where everyone gives the orders."
"It is the fate of the great ones of this earth, to be appreciated only after they are gone."
"Only when you have eaten a lemon do you appreciate what sugar is."
"You only appreciate your father the day you become a father yourself."
"As soon as you have finished a job, you start appreciating the difficulties."
"You never miss the water till the well runs dry."
"Who does not thank for little will thank for much."
"People who have bread to eat do not appreciate the severity of a famine."
"Hay is more acceptable to an ass than gold."
"Take hold of a good minute."
"Even the smallest drop is appreciated by the drunkard."
"If there’s no bread, cakes are very good."
"Only with a new ruler do you realize the value of the old."
"To him who is determined it remains only to act."
"A face that never laughs betrays an evil heart."
"Time spent laughing is time spent with the Gods."
"When men speak of the future, the gods laugh."
"The teeth that laugh are also those that bite."
"Laughing wife, crying purse."
"The deaf laugh twice."
"He laughs best who laughs last."
"Laugh and grow fat."
"A naked man will often laugh at someone with torn clothes."
"Gold that is lent goes away laughing and comes back in tears."
"Learn from your tears and you will win laughing."
"He, who laughs too much, is hiding his grief."
"Annoy your doctor and sickness comes in laughing."
"When the child falls the mother weeps; when the mother falls the child laughs."
"You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept."
"The laugh is always on the loser."
"It is better to weep with wise men than to laugh with fools."
"People show their character by what they laugh at."
"A day is lost if one has not laughed."
"When two poor men help each other, God laughs."
"A woman that always laughs is everybody’s wife; a man that is always laughing is an idiot."
"Weeping bride, laughing wife, laughing bride, weeping wife."
"When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when a son gives to his father, both cry."
"Follow the advice of the one who makes you cry, not from the one who makes you laugh."
"A man laughs at others and weeps for himself."
"Laugh before breakfast, you’ll cry before supper."
"What is viler than to be laughed at?."
"Laugh, and the world laughs with you; weep, and you weep alone."
"When two friends dip into their purse, one laughs, the other cries."
"Those who love you will make you weep; those who hate you will make you laugh."
"Your years will still remain the same whether you laugh or cry."
"If you are too busy to laugh, you are too busy."
"A mind conscious of innocence laughs at the lies of rumor."
"They will be hushed by a good deed who laughs at a wise speech."
"When an old man marries, death laughs."
"When the mouse laughs at the cat, there is a hole nearby."
"If you call a lady a slave, she laughs, but if you call a slave a slave, he cries."
"When a woman laughs an experienced man will know how much it will cost him."
"Don’t laugh when your neighbor’s oven is on fire."
"A rich widow weeps in one eye and laughs with the other."
"God laughs at man’s proposal."
"One with the courage to laugh is the master of the world almost as much as the man who is ready to die."
"Do not laugh at the fallen; you may find slippery roads ahead."
"When the thief has stolen from a thief, God laughs in heaven."
"Laugh and everyone sees it, cry and no one sees it."
"A good laugh and a long sleep are the best cures in the doctor’s book."
"Laugh, if you are wise."
"Among those who laugh, do not weep; among those who weep, do not laugh."
"If Jesus Christ comes to help me, I laugh at the angels."
"Laughing is not always the proof of a mind at ease."
"He who tickles himself can laugh whenever he wants."
"When you talk about future happenings the devil starts to laugh."
"The gods just laugh when men pray to them for wealth."
"It is a wise man who can laugh at his own jokes."
"Always be patient with the rich and powerful."
"The barking dog gives you no power — it gives you fear."
"You can’t use your hand to force the sun to set."
"Under a powerful general there are no feeble soldiers."
"Community is not made by force."
"Beauty is power."
"Where power reigns there is no room for reason."
"If power can be bought then sell your mother to get it."
"Force without forecast is to little avail."
"If the devil is powerless, send him a woman."
"Power lasts ten years; influence not more than a hundred."
"The tree breaks that takes all the force of the wind."
"Power acquired by guilt was never used for a good purpose."
"Patience is power; with time and patience the mulberry becomes silk."
"Only when a new government comes to power do you learn to appreciate the values of the old one."
"Against the beastly human being even the gods are powerless."
"No matter how hidden a force is, it will attract some kind of resistance."
"The powerful are never faithful."
"Hurrying and worrying are not the same as strength."
"Loving and singing are not to be forced."
"Cunning is better than force."
"You can’t force anyone to love you or lend you money."
"Give up the smallest part of a secret, and the rest is no longer in your power."
"Who is forced to go to church will not pray."
"When a king is about to lose his power his orders burn more intensely than fire."
"Where right has no power — there power likes to be."
"A little subtleness is better than a lot of force."
"Deceive the rich and powerful if you will, but don’t insult them."
"Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do so."
"Fashion is more powerful than any tyrant."
"The less power a man has, the more he likes to use it."
"The lion’s power lies in our fear of him."
"Who has power in his hands has no need to lie; he uses violence."
"He who fears something gives it power over him."
"Force is that which rules the actions without regulating the will."
"Patience is power; with time and patience the mulberry leaf becomes a silk gown."
"If a man becomes powerful even his chicken and his dog go to heaven."
"Better a friendly refusal than an unwilling promise."
"Don’t promise something when you are full of joy; don’t answer letters when you are full of anger."
"Promises are like the full moon, if they are not kept at once they diminish day by day."
"Promises make debt, and debt makes promises."
"In the midst of great joy, do not promise anyone anything. In the midst of great anger, do not answer anyone’s letter."
"From the promise to the deed is a day’s journey."
"When a man repeats a promise again and again, he means to fail you."
"The world has not made a promise to anybody."
"Promise little and do a lot."
"We make big promises to avoid little presents."
"A promise is a cloud; fulfillment is rain."
"The day cuts off the promise of the night."
"He loses his thanks who promises and delays."
"The day will wipe out all the promises of the night."
"Many promises impair confidence."
"Never promise a poor person, and never owe a rich one."
"Don’t expect from others what you can’t promise them yourself."
"God promises a safe landing but not a calm passage."
"Eggs and promises are easily broken."
"Mother earth promised to tell her secrets to heaven."
"When you are sick you promise a goat, but when you are well again make do with a chicken."
"A promise is a comfort for a fool."
"There are no greater promisers than those who have nothing to give."
"Promises have legs. Only a gift has hands."
"He promised me earrings, but then only pierced my ears."
"God promised me a fur coat and I’m already sweating."
"Promised berries will not fill the basket."
"A promise is a debt."
"Men apt to promise are apt to forget."
"Evening promises are like butter: morning comes, and it’s all melted."
"An un kept promise leads to a bad life."
"In the land of promise a man may die of hunger."
"No greater promisers than they who have nothing to give."
"No strength within, no respect without."
"If your strength is small, don’t carry heavy burdens. If your words are worthless, don’t give advice."
"Lower your voice and strengthen your argument."
"The cold strengthens you more than hunger."
"Cunning surpasses strength."
"The thrower of stones throws away the strength of his own arm."
"Absence sharpens love; presence strengthens it."
"Hurrying and worrying are not the same as strength."
"Distance tests a horse’s strength; time reveals a marls character."
"The strength of the heart comes from the soundness of the faith."
"The weakness of an enemy forms part of our own strength."
"Dwell not upon thy weariness, thy strength shall be according to the measure of thy desire."
"A woman’s strength is a multitude of words."
"Man is like palm-wine: when young, sweet but without strength; in old age, strong but harsh."
"If the ox knew his own strength, God help us."
"If thy strength will serve, go forward in the ranks; if not, stand still."
"There is no strength without unity."
"Men know not all their faults, oxen all their strength."
"You know a man by the sweat of his brow and the strength of his word."
"Gain from your opponents without sacrificing your own strength."
"Three things give us hardy strength: sleeping on hairy mattresses, breathing cold air, and eating dry food."
"Once I had the strength but no wisdom; now I have the wisdom but no strength."
"With true friends . . . even water drunk together is sweet enough."
"Marriages are all happy. It’s having breakfast together that causes all the trouble."
"Two shorten the road."
"Every woman needs two men — one to be married to and the other to compare."
"A friend is one soul in two bodies."
"Cheerful company shortens the journey."
"In the world all things are two and two."
"Keep your tents apart and your hearts together."
"Love puts the fun in together, the sad in apart, and the joy in a heart."
"Two is an army against one."
"Birds of a feather flock together."
"The family that prays together stays together."
"Two is good, one alone cannot wash his back."
"It takes two to tango."
"If the family is together, the soul is in the right place."
"Children are buttonholes that hold their parents together."
"No road is too long in the company of a friend."
"In the company of the good we become good."
"The teeth often bite the tongue, still the two stay together."
"If a job’s worth doing, it’s worth doing well."
"If young men had wit and old men strength everything might be well done."
"The shortest answer is doing."
"Well begun is half done."
"Doing is better than saying."
"Thinking well is wise; planning well, wiser; but doing well is the wisest and best of all."
"If the young knew and the old could, there is nothing that couldn’t be done."
"The man who says it cannot be done, should not interrupt a man who is doing it."
"If you want a thing well done, do it yourself."
"Conscience is what tells you not to do what you have just done."
"He who is afraid of doing too much always does too little."
"Your hand is never the worse for doing its own work."
"There are three things that have to be done quickly: burying the dead, opening the door for a stranger, and fixing your daughter’s wedding."
"He that is doing nothing is seldom in need of helpers."
"If you give orders and leave, the work won’t get done."
"To know how to do it is simple, the difficulty is in doing it."
"Young people tell what they are doing, old people what they have done, and fools what they wish to do."
"Do well the little things now; so shall great things come to thee by and by asking to be done."
"When a thing is done, advice comes too late."
"If you have never done anything evil, you should not be worrying about devils knocking at your door."
"You should have done it on the wedding night, you fool!"
"After all is said and done, more is said than done."
"No one is hurt by doing the right thing."
"Virtue is not knowing but doing."
"Could everything be done twice it would be done better."
"There is a deep sea between saying and doing."
"Insanity is doing the same thing in the same way and expecting a different outcome."
"The reward of a thing rightly done is to have done it."
"A work ill done must be twice done."
"By doing nothing we learn to do ill."
"Never forget benefits done you, regardless how small."
"What may be done at any time will be done at no time."
"The devil takes a hand in what is done in haste."
"Lazy people are always eager to be doing something."
"Easier said than done."
"Something is either done or it is not done."
"You cannot be very smart if you have never done anything foolish."
"When the deal is done, discuss it no more; it is difficult to collect dispersed water."
"The pleasure of doing good is the only one that will not wear out."
"Work is twice done by the man in a hurry."
"Little is done where many command."
"Pay beforehand if you would have your work poorly done."
"What is done cannot be undone."
"Quickly done; long repented."
"Some people want to be praised for the rest of their lives for what they have done well for one day."
"Between saying and doing, many a pair of shoes is worn out."
"One lives in the world’s memory only by what they have done in the world’s behalf."
"If you want a thing well done, do it yourself."
"What’s done cannot be undone."
"Do little things now; so shall big things come to thee by and by asking to be done."
"He who has done evil, expects evil."
"The grown-up pays attention to what you are doing; the child sees beyond that."
"Biggest profits mean gravest risks."
"Better to risk a little than to lose the whole."
"He who risks nothing can gain nothing."
"Risk – If one as to jump a stream and knows how wide it is, he will not jump. If he doesn’t know how wide it is, he’ll jump and six times out of ten he’ll make it"
"He who doesn’t risk never gets to drink champagne."
"He that holds the handle of a frying-pan runs the risk of burning himself."
"A cat loves fish, but won’t risk its claws."
"If you must play, decide upon three things at the start: the rules of the game, the stakes, and the quitting time. "
"Keep going, for success lies just around the corner for those who refuse to quit."
"Of all the stratagems, to know when to quit is the best."
"Quit not certainty for hope."
"The dog that quits barking can get some sleep."
"It’s when things get rough and you don’t quit, that success comes."
"When pleasure interferes with business, give up business."
"Don’t stop sowing just because the birds ate a few seeds."
"If the wine bothers you while you work, stop working."
"A man dies when he stops working."
"In a game it’s difficult to know when to stop."
"When the will is ready the feet are light."
"If the time has passed, there is no point in preparing."
"If you want to be happy for a year, plant a garden; If you want to be happy for life, plant a tree."
"He who hides his faults plans to make more."
"Thinking well is wise; planning well, wiser; but doing well is the wisest and best of all."
"An accidental meeting is more pleasant than a planned one."
"The rich man plans for tomorrow, the poor man for today."
"The lazier a man is, the more he plans to do tomorrow."
"If you don’t have a plan for yourself, you’ll be part of someone else’s."
"Eat when the meal is ready, speak when the time is ripe."
"Prepare yourself for when the water comes up to your knees."
"Man has a thousand plans, heaven but one."
"The way you prepare the bed, so shall you sleep."
"Coincidence defeats a well-laid plan."
"If you are planning to travel where corn grows, you should take a sickle with you."
"The best laid plans of mice and men often go awry."
"He that parts with his property before his death prepares himself for much suffering."
"Thirty-six plans of how to win the battle are not so good as one plan to withdraw from the fight."
"My fathers planted for me, and I planted for my children."
"If you wish for peace be ready for war."
"When one is prepared, difficulties do not come."
"One with the courage to laugh is master of the world almost as much as the one who is ready to die."
"It’s a bad plan that cannot be changed."
"Hope for the best, but prepare for the worst."
"If you are planning for a year, sow rice; if you are planning for a decade, plant trees; if you are planning for a lifetime, educate people."
"Let the sword decide only after the plan has failed."
"Plan your life at New Year’s eve, your day at dawn."
"You must be fully prepared to lose a great deal in order to make a great deal."
"Last night I made a thousand plans, but this morning I went my old way."
"A thousand workers, a thousand plans."
"To make preparations does not spoil the trip."
"Before you prepare to improve the world, look around your own house three times."
"Need teaches a plan."
"To win a war quickly takes long preparation."
"Our faults provide opportunities for others."
"Seize the opportunity by the beard, for it is bald behind."
"The opportunity of a lifetime is seldom so labeled."
"The opportunity that God sends does not wake up him who sleeps."
"Opportunity seldom knocks twice."
"The thief who has no opportunity to steal thinks he is an honest man."
"Opportunities neglected can never be recovered."
"Four things come not back: the spoken word, the spent arrow, the past life, and the neglected opportunity."
"Opportunity creates desire."
"Opportunity has hair in front, behind she is bald; if you seize her by the forelock, you may hold her, but, if suffered to escape, not Jupiter himself can catch her again."
"Hell is paved with good intentions, roofed in with lost opportunities."
"Opportunities may come but they never linger."
"What is earned with hard labor is eaten with pleasure."
"The king inherits a country — the people only hard work."
"He has hard work who has nothing to do."
"When hard work goes out of the door, poverty comes in at the window."
"The hardest work of all is to do nothing."
"Whenever I work hard for other people, I always sleep on an empty stomach."
"Before you can score, you must first have a goal."
"God makes three requests of his children: Do the best you can, where you are, with what you have, now."
"No wind is of service to him that is bound for nowhere."
"He who hunts two hares leaves one and loses the other."
"Vision without action is a daydream. Action with without vision is a nightmare."
"Set your sail according to the wind."
"To be willing is to be able."
"If you want to build high, you must dig deep."
"If you plant grass, you won’t get rice"
"It takes a whole village to raise a child."
"The world does not make promises to anybody."
"Once does not mean frequently, and twice does not mean constantly."
"If you put in you can take out."
"Who has no courage must have legs."
"When you have no choice, mobilize the spirit of courage."
"There are three friends in this world: courage, sense, and insight."
"The fox will catch you with cunning, and the wolf with courage."
"Some have been thought brave because they didn’t have the courage to run away."
"One with the courage to laugh is master of the world almost as much as the one who is ready to die."
"In the face of love and death, courage is useless."
"Courage is ten, nine is the ability to escape."
"Courage is often caused by fear."
"Courage is a kingdom without a crown."
"People will ignore their misfortunes and their interests when they are in competition with their pleasures."
"No dew ever competed with the sun."
"Competition is the whetstone of talent."
"Compete, don’t envy."
"Actions speak louder than words."
"Between saying and doing many a pair of shoes is worn out."
"A man’s actions are more important than his ancestry."
"A promise is a cloud; fulfillment is rain."
"Do not be wise in words — be wise in deeds."
"For the sake of one good action, a hundred evil ones should be forgotten."
"Force is that which rules the actions without regulating the will."
"Good actions are never lost."
"If you commence a good action, leave it not incomplete."
"If you want to know your past, look into your present conditions. If you want to know your future — look into your present actions."
"If your inner mind isn’t deceived, your outer actions won’t be wrong."
"Innocent actions carry their warrant with them."
"Never repent a good action."
"Talk doesn’t cook rice."
"Talking is easy, action is difficult."
"The beginning is the half of every action."
"The first step binds one to the second."
"Water quenches the thirst but does not teach you how to sing."
"When the Spaniard sings he is either stupid or without money."
"When we sing everybody hears us, when we sigh nobody hears us."
"If you can walk you can dance. If you can talk you can sing."
"Not everyone who sings a lullaby stays awake."
"It is folly to sing twice to a deaf man."
"As the abbot sings the sacristan responds."
"Conversation shortens the distance, singing lightens the load."
"Drink and sing: the dark night is ahead of us."
"When mosquitoes work, they bite and then they sing."
"Singing "Alleluia" everywhere does not prove piety."
"Bad people don’t sing."
"You can cage a bird but you can’t make it sing."
"If I keep a green bough in my heart, the singing bird will come."
"It is not summer until the crickets sing."
"Theologians, dogs, and singers always disagree."
"If a bird knew how poor he was it wouldn’t sing so beautifully."
"What the old ones sing, the young ones whistle."
"Three things that can’t be taught: generosity, poetry and a singing voice."
"Singing birds don’t build nests."
"An empty barrel sings in the wind."
"The fool sings a love song to his wife, the wise man will talk about his dog."
"The chicken sings what the cock teaches him."
"Even the sharpest ear cannot hear an ant singing."
"To sing to the deaf, to talk with the dumb, and to dance for the blind are three foolish things."
"Let someone else sing your praise."
"As the old birds sing, so the young ones twitter."
"When danger approaches, sing to it."
"He who sings, frightens away all his ills."
"Birds of prey do not sing."
"Water teaches us to weep, wine teaches us to sing."
"If you sing before breakfast, you’ll cry before night."
"The mosquito is small — but when he sings, your ears are full of him."
"There are many people who can sing, but don’t know the words."
"When a woman is not singing, she is not working much either."
"When the music changes, so does the dance."
"Love begins with song and music and ends in a sea of tears."
"When girls whistle, the Holy Virgin cries."
"There is no woman who sleeps so deeply that the sound of a guitar won’t bring her to the window."
"Those who cant dance blame it on the music."
"Move your neck according to the music."
"To heaven for the music but to hell for a good conversation."
"Silence is music to a wise man."
"The mouth is not sweetened by saying "Honey, honey." So the music, so the people."
"It is a wise man who can laugh at his own jokes."
"Always tell the truth in the form of a joke."
"Marry for money, my little sonny, a rich man’s joke is always funny."
"If I am seen I am joking; if I am not seen I steal."
"He that jokes confesses."
"At the gambling table, there are no fathers and sons."
"Nobody has ever bet enough on a winning horse."
"There is no lock on the purse of a gambler."
"In a bet there is a fool and a thief."
"Gamblers do not contribute to the public welfare."
"I have denounced everything but wine. I have foresworn everything but gambling."
"Reform a gambler. Cure leprosy."
"Young gamblers, old beggars."
"Nine gamblers could not feed a single rooster."
"One hundred alcoholics are better than one gambler."
"He who can persuade someone not to gamble has earned money for him."
"Rich gamblers and old trumpeters are rare."
"There is no better gambling than not to gamble."
"There are two great pleasures in gambling: that of winning and that of losing."
"Gambling is the son of avarice and the father of despair."
"A spoiled son becomes a gambler, while a spoiled daughter becomes a harlot."
"A pack of cards is the devil’s prayer-book."
"Life is like a game in which God shuffles the cards, the devil deals them and we have to play the trumps."
"The shovel insults the poker."
"Rule: Never perform card tricks for the people you play poker with."
"Lucky at cards, unlucky in love."
"With someone holding nothing but trumps it is impossible to play cards."
"There’s more to dancing than a pair of dancing shoes."
"I dance to the tune that is played."
"When the music changes, so does the dance."
"Do not choose your wife at a dance, but in the field among the harvesters."
"A woman who dances too much gets ill from little work."
"A smart witch can also dance without a broomstick."
"Who dances at the wedding, weeps at the funeral."
"A poor dancer will be disturbed even by the hem of her skirt."
"Life is like a ballet performance — danced only once."
"He who has no shoes dances in his socks."
"Dance to the tune that is played."
"Those who cant dance blame it on the music."
"The rich man never dances badly."
"If everyone is going to dance, then who will watch?"
"The man who can’t dance thinks the band is no good."
"A bad dancer always has trouble with his balls."
"To sing to the deaf, to talk with the dumb, and to dance for the blind are three foolish things."
"You dance better with a full belly than with a new dress."
"All are not merry that dance lightly."
"The cripple is always the one to open the dancing."
"It is good to dance on another man’s floor."
"He who is unable to dance blames it in the stony yard."
"With time even a bear can learn to dance."
"The soul of a fool is always dancing on the tip of his tongue."
"It is always the fat ones who lead the dance."
"Don’t dance on a volcano."
"Even the fall of a dancer is a somersault."
"The hunt is like a dance for men, for the women the dance is the hunt."
"We’re fools whether we dance or not, so we might as well dance."
"The girl who can’t dance says the band can’t play."
"If you can walk you can dance. If you can talk you can sing."
"Dancing at the carnival, baptizing on All Saints Day."
"He who has an egg in his pocket does not dance."
"If you are dancing with your rivals, don’t close your eyes."
"To watch us dance is to hear our hearts speak."
"When the ass is too happy he begins dancing on the ice."
"If you can’t dance well, you’d better not get up."
"Money makes even dogs dance."
"The devil dances in empty pockets."
"Only chained bears dance."
"You cannot dance well on only one leg."
"If the bride can’t dance, she blames the musicians."
"Of what use is the veil if you are going to dance."
"Eggs have no business dancing with stones."
"If you’ve enjoyed the dance, pay the musicians."
"Better being alone than in bad company."
"He who has travelled alone can tell what he likes."
"Marriage teaches you to live alone."
"Curse your wife at evening, sleep alone at night."
"Man can’t live in this world alone."
"Leave well alone."
"Who speaks alone is always right."
"It is unpleasant to go alone, even to be drowned."
"A party of one alone is not a party."
"One would not be alone even in Paradise."
"It may be quieter to sleep alone, but not warmer."
"Better be quarrelling than lonesome."
"Laugh, and the world laughs with you; weep, and you weep alone."
"Pretend to be dead and the bull will leave you alone."
"Try to be in good company, even when you are alone."
"Play alone and you’re bound to win."
"He who walks alone shall surely arrive first."
"Even in paradise it is no fun to be alone."
"One who runs alone cannot be outrun by another."
"He who eats alone is Satan’s brother."
"The great question is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with failure."
"From success to failure is one step; from failure to success is a long road."
"The first pancake is always a failure."
"Success has many parents, but failure is an orphan."
"Fail to steal the chicken while it ate up your bait grain."
"Let the sword decide only after the plan has failed."
"If the bread in the oven is a failure you lose a week; if the harvest is a failure you lose a year; if marriage is a failure then you lose a life."
"A proud heart can survive a general failure because such a failure does not prick its pride."
"It is a mistake to suppose that people succeed through success; they often succeed through failures."
"If you fail to practice your art, it will soon disappear."
"The matchmaker gets three cups of wine when he succeeds and three slaps on the cheek when he fails."
"The palace leads to fame, the market to fortune, and loneliness to wisdom.
"A lonely person is at home everywhere."
"Loneliness breaks the spirit."
"In a choice between bad company and loneliness — the second is preferable."
"Strife is better than loneliness."
"Old mistakes need more friends than new truths."
"He who covers up his mistakes intends to make some more."
"Man loves his own mistakes."
"Mistakes occur through haste, never through doing a thing leisurely."
"The fool’s excuse is bigger than the mistake he made."
"If a rich man steals it is a mistake; if a poor man makes a mistake he has stolen."
"Better a mistake at the beginning than at the end."
"Always leave a little room for a mistake."
"Let a wrong-doing repeat itself at least three times: the first may be an accident, the second a mistake, but the third is likely to be intentional."
"It is better to be ignorant than mistaken."
"We learn from our mistakes."
"You never are so easily mistaken as when you think you know the way."
"The fast talker makes mistakes."
"Be not ashamed of mistakes and thus make them crimes."
"He that counts his friend’s mistakes will be abandoned by him."
"Only he who does nothing makes a mistake."
"A mule that thinks he is a stag discovers his mistake when he comes to leap over the ditch."
"A known mistake is better than an unknown truth."
"The man who never makes a mistake always takes orders from one who does."
"The mistakes of others are good teachers."
"Never point out the mistakes of another with a dirty finger."
"A man in love mistakes a pimple for a dimple."
"The earth will cover the doctor’s mistakes."
"The first mistake are theirs who commit them, the second are theirs that permit them."
"Even champions make mistakes — there is no one who doesn’t."
"The patient who names a doctor his heir makes a big mistake."
"Your friend will swallow your mistakes; your enemy will present them on a plate."
"He who knows much makes many mistakes."
"The humble pay for the mistakes of their betters."
"The thief makes perhaps one mistake; those he stole from made a hundred."
"He is always right who suspects that he makes mistakes."
"The rich man makes mistakes and the poor men get the blame."
"There are no beautiful prisons or ugly loved ones."
"Steal goods and you’ll go to prison, steal lands and you are a king."
"Keep the tongue in your mouth a prisoner."
"He who is born in jail loves jail."
"A day in prison is longer than a thousand years at large."
"Truth will take you everywhere — even to jail."
"A bean in liberty is better than a comfit in prison."
"A woman is a fortress, a man her prisoner."
"A sick person is a prisoner."
"Satan’s friendship reaches the prison door."
"So long as I can keep a secret it is my prisoner. If I let it slip then I am its prisoner."
"It is not at the table but in prison that you learn who your true friends are."
"The jail is closed day and night and always full; temples are always open and still empty."
"A country without freedom is like a prisoner with shackled hands."
"Shyness is the prison of the heart."
"Earth is like a prison: we all go in through the same door, but we stay in different cells."
"Forgiveness hides a pleasure that you can’t get back from revenge."
"No revenge is more honorable than the one not taken."
"He who seeks revenge should remember to dig two graves."
"Ambition and revenge are always hungry."
"Revenge converts a little right into a great wrong."
"Pray for revenge, and God will turn a deaf ear."
"When Anger and Revenge get married, their daughter is called Cruelty."
"A hundred-year-old revenge still has its baby teeth."
"Revenge is a dish that should be eaten cold."
"Shameful deeds bring on revenge."
"Revenge is a dish that tastes better cold."
"Revenge is sweet."
"Revenge is a confession of pain."
"Widows comfort themselves when they remarry, widowers take revenge."
"If you want to be revenged, hold your tongue."
"He, who takes revenge for a small insult, will have a bigger one thrown at him."
"If you want to take revenge on a man, send him a really beautiful woman."
"He, who stands by his point of view, must be ready to suffer hunger."
"Who suffers from love, feels no pain."
"What matter if I suffer, if only my neighbor suffers too."
"God does not love those who have not suffered."
"When a king makes a mistake, all the people suffer."
"He, who cannot suffer discomfort, will not be called for important things."
"When the head does not work, the legs suffer."
"If you want your children to enjoy a quiet life let them suffer a little hunger and a little cold."
"When you are rich you suffer in a more comfortable way."
"Hard heads suffer much."
"If God wants people to suffer, he sends them too much understanding."
"The main thing is that we can smile at our duties — yes even at our suffering."
"We must learn from life how to suffer it."
"He, who fears to suffer, suffers from fear."
"A small cottage wherein laughter lives is worth more than a castle full of tears."
"If a man makes soup of his tears, ask him not for broth."
"A tear in the eye is the wound of the heart."
"The pearls of a bride on her wedding day are the tears that will be shed later."
"Love begins with song and music and ends in a sea of tears."
"Nothing dries so fast as tears."
"The tears of an heir are laughter under a mask."
"A tear at the right moment is better than a misplaced smile."
"Patience begins with tears and ends with a smile."
"Tears have meaning but only he who sheds them understands."
"God counts her tears."
"Learn from your tears and you will win laughing."
"What soap is for the body, tears are for the soul."
"Gold that is lent goes away laughing and comes back in tears."
"If there were no tears, our ribs would burn."
"A wise man sees only water in the tears of a woman."
"Morning rain and women’s tears dry as fast as each other."
"Who bathes his hands in blood will have to wash them with tears."
"Onions, smoke and women bring tears to your eyes."
"The tears of the adulteress are ever ready to be shed."
"Nothing dries faster than tears."
"Wealth can give legs to the cripple, beauty to the ugly, and sympathy to tears."
"In youth, one has tears without grief; in age, grief without tears."
"Sweet are the tears that are dried by your loved one."
"The eyes of all cheats are full of tears."
"Repentant tears wash out the stain of guilt."
"If the heart is sad, tears will flow."
"A pound’s worth of tears will not settle a penny’s worth of debt."
"Every tear has a smile behind it."
"Tears come more often from the eyes than from the heart."
"When you die, your sister’s tears will dry as time goes on, your widow’s tears will end in another’s arms, but your mother will mourn you until the day she dies."
"The tears of strangers are only water."
"The heir’s tears are but a mask to disguise his joy."
"The tears of the roasting meat kindle the fire even more."
"He wastes his tears who weeps before the judge."
"A woman’s heart dries quicker than her tears."
"A woman’s tears are worth a lot, but cost little."
"Never trouble trouble till trouble troubles you."
"Keep away from trouble and sing to it."
"The pool has dried up, and the fish is in trouble."
"Beautiful woman, beautiful trouble."
"When one is in trouble, one remembers God."
"He that has a choice has trouble."
"He that seeks trouble never misses."
"To trouble me is better than to forget me."
"When in charge, ponder. When in trouble, delegate. When in doubt, mumble."
"Marriages are all happy. It’s having breakfast together that causes all the trouble."
"Everything is small at the beginning and then grows; except trouble, which is big at the beginning and still grows."
"A hand that is ready to hit may cause you great trouble."
"When you have a good government the grass will grow over your troubles."
"He who has a choice has trouble."
"Sleep is the best cure for waking troubles."
"If you are always dwelling in trouble, change your address."
"A flea can trouble a lion more than the lion can harm a flea."
"If you know the beginning well, the end will not trouble you."
"A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all."
"To loan is to buy troubles."
"The drowning man is not troubled by rain."
"Don’t meet troubles half-way."
"The word "yes" brings trouble; the word "no" leads to no evil."
"Forgetting trouble is the way to cure it."
"Never trust the man who tells you all his troubles but keeps from you all his joys."
"Ambition begets troubles."
"When an elephant is in trouble even a frog will kick him."
"Trouble will rain on those who are already wet."
"All people are your relatives, therefore expect only trouble from them."
"The wedding lasts for two or three days, but the trouble stays longer."
"A fish wouldn’t get into trouble if it kept its mouth shut."
"A bad dancer always has trouble with his balls."
"A small cottage wherein laughter lives is worth more than a castle full of tears."
"If a man makes soup of his tears, ask him not for broth."

"The tears of the roasting meat kindle the fire even more."
"He wastes his tears who weeps before the judge."
"A woman’s heart dries quicker than her tears."
"A woman’s tears are worth a lot, but cost little."
"Every answer can result in a new question."
"Even silence is an answer."
"Death answers before it is asked."
"It is a good answer which knows when to stop."
"No answer is also an answer."
"The best answer to anger is silence."
"If a dog’s prayers were answered, bones would rain from the skies."
"Silence is the best answer to the stupid. The fool has his answer on the tip of his tongue."
"Wise people can’t answer the most foolish questions."
"A soft answer turneth away wrath."
"He who answers is inferior to the one who asks the question."
"Act honestly, and answer boldly."
"You must answer the devil in his own language."
"To every answer you can find a new question."
"To spread the news is to multiply it."
"The news of a good deed travels far, but the news of a bad one travels even farther."
"People talk about something until it actually happens."
"News does not sleep on the way."
"Words have no wings but they can fly many thousands of miles."
"When you begin to understand the situation, you know you must have been ill-informed."
"When what you want doesn’t happen, learn to want what does."
"When asked, "What news from the sea?" The fish replied "I have a lot to say, but my mouth is full of water.""
"The wise understand; fools follow the reports of others."
"The fated thing will happen."
"It is always the impossible that happens."
"if you don’t read the newspaper, you are uninformed. if you do read the newspaper, you are misinformed."
"Good news always comes from far away."
"Give your ears to words but do not give your words to ears."
"For news of the heart ask the face."
"Events follow one another like the days of the week."
"Death is always news."
"Dead news, like dead love, has no phoenix in its ashes."
"Consider the facts seven times before you suspect someone."
"Between two Saturdays happen many marvels."
"Bad news travels fast."
"Bad news has wings."
"Bad is never good until worse happens."
"Bad is called good when worse happens."
"As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country."
"Any publicity is good publicity."
"Where curiosity is not the purveyor, detraction will soon be starved."
"Curiosity killed the cat."
"Be not curious in unnecessary matters: for more things are shrewd unto thee than men understand."
"Sticks and stones will break my bones, but names will never hurt me."
"Life is for one generation; a good name is forever."
"A change of name or place may sometimes save a person."
"A bad son gives his mother a bad name."
"A good name is better than precious ointment."
"Before you beat the dog, find out the name of his master."
"Don’t think back on someone whose name you forgot, he is probably someone else by now."
"Give a dog a bad name and hang him."
"Go not in and out of court that thy name may not stink."
"Good men must die, but death cannot kill their names."
"You know a person by his nickname."
"The river may dry up but she keeps her name."
"A good name is better than a precious stone."
"A good name reaches far but a bad one reaches farther."
"Only when the coffin is closed will we see how long lasting is the name."
"The beginning of wisdom is to call things by their right names."
"A person with a bad name is already half-hanged."
"A good name is better than good habits."
"From our ancestors come our names from our virtues our honor."
"A good name is a second inheritance."
"Beloved children have many names."
"Don’t give a child a name until after it is born."
"Better to die than to live on with a bad name."
"The name of Love’s fiance is Divorce."
"He who gets a name for early rising can stay in bed until midday."
"They ate our food, and forgot our names."
"A good name is more desirable than great riches."
"No names, no pack-drill."
"A good name is more valuable than a velvet garment."
"Tigers die and leave their skins; people die and leave their names."
"A bad wound may heal, but a bad name will kill."
"Silence is the best answer to the stupid."
"Against stupidity; God Himself is helpless."
"Silence is the best answer to the stupid. The fool has his answer on the tip of his tongue."
"The stupid fear fortune, the wise endure it."
"Cruelty is stupidity."
"Giving advice to a stupid man is like giving salt to a squirrel."
"Stupidity begins with honesty."
"The most stupid chicken always challenges the wildcat."
"Wisdom is born; stupidity is learned."
"Stupidity won’t kill you, but it can make you sweat."
"Better a stupid wife than a mess at home."
"If a rich man ate a snake, they would say it was because of his wisdom; if a poor man ate it, they would say it was because of his stupidity."
"One stupid woman recognizes another one from a distance."
"A stupid act entails doing the work twice over."
"When the Spaniard sings he is either stupid or without money."
"Stupidity is a force unto itself."
"An intelligent enemy is better than a stupid friend."
"Too clever is stupid."
"You are learning all your life and you die stupid."
"A stupid friend is a greater plague than a wise enemy."
"Seek the brave in prison and the stupid among the clergy."
