"To give jewels to a donkey is as stupid as giving a eunuch to a woman."
"The people who talk the best are not the only ones who can tell you the most interesting things."
"Young people talk of what they are doing; old people of what they have done; and fools of what they have a mind to do."
"Excessive talk is sure to include errors."
"When money is talking, the rest of the world shuts up."
"The fool sings a love song to his wife; the wise man will talk about his dog."
"Many talk like philosophers yet live like fools."
"The best thing about animals is they don’t talk much."
"The mouth which eats does not talk."
"Who talks a lot at the table will leave it hungry."
"A person who talks a lot is sometimes right."
"A woman’s work is worth more than the talk of a thousand men."
"Money talks — everything else walks."
"Talk does not cook rice."
"Not only those who can talk the best tell you the most interesting things."
"When you talk about future happenings the devil starts to laugh."
"Talk of the devil and he’ll appear."
"One timely shout is better than constant talk."
"A bad word whispered will echo a hundred miles."
"Never whisper to the deaf, or wink at the blind."
"The fall of a leaf is a whisper to the living."
"The whisper of a pretty girl can be heard further off than the roar of a lion."
"What is whispered in your ear is often heard a hundred miles off."
"I am talking to you, daughter-in-law, so that you could hear it, neighbor!"
"A talkative bird will not build a nest."
"To talk without thinking is to shoot without aiming."
"Italians talk to women, Frenchmen to the learned, and the Spaniard talks to God."
"He who talks incessantly, talks nonsense."
"Scholars talk books, butchers talk pigs."
"Who talks little hears better."
"Leave a great talker in the middle of the street."
"A woman talks to one man, looks at another, and thinks about a third."
"He who wants to talk with the dogs must learn to bark."
"Talking to one another is loving one another."
"People talk about something until it actually happens."
"Talk is cheap but it takes money to buy whiskey."
"Think with the wise, but talk with the vulgar."
"Always talk big and you will never be forgotten."
"Don’t talk unless you can improve the silence."
"Two good talkers are not worth one good listener."
"People who have little to do are excessive talkers."
"Who talks a lot, talks about himself."
"It is better to talk to a woman and think of God, than talk to God and think of a woman."
"Talking is easy, action difficult."
"He who talks continuously, talks nonsense."
"In much talk there is much irrelevancies."
"A bad man talks about what he has eaten and drunk — a good man about what he has seen and heard."
"If you can walk you can dance. If you can talk you can sing."
"Talk less, say more; hate less, love more; and all good things are yours."
"The less people think the more they talk."
"If you are a fast talker at least think slowly."
"Love talks, even with closed lips."
"Talking is silver, silence is golden."
"Beware of a man that does not talk and a dog that does not bark."
"Though talking face to face, their hearts are a thousand miles apart."
"He who talks to a silent listener will soon stand naked."
"He, who always wants the last word, ends up talking to himself."
"It’s not the fault of the parrot, but of the one who teaches him to talk."
"Two great talkers never go far together."
"Talk of the devil, and he is bound to appear."
"The fast talker makes mistakes."
"The talkers aren’t strong; the strong don’t talk."
"One must talk little, and listen a lot."
"I’m talking to the door, but I want the walls to hear me."
"Much talk, little work."
"Don’t talk too much — your ignorance exceeds your knowledge."
"The talk of the day is the dream of the night."
"Great talker, great liar."
"With a full belly it is easy to talk about fasting."
"If you keep on talking, you will end up saying what you didn’t intend to say."
"Talking without thinking is shooting without aiming."
"Listening well is as powerful as talking well, and is also as essential to true conversation."
"By learning you will teach, by teaching you will learn."
"In teaching others we teach ourselves."
"Who God does not teach, man cannot."
"Love teaches even asses to dance."
"He who flatters me is my enemy, who blames me is my teacher."
"To teach well, we need not say all that we know, Successful teachers are effective in spite of the psychological theories they suffer under."
"A wise teacher makes learning a joy."
"If the pupil is smart, the teacher gets the credit."
"Teach thy tongue to say, "I do not know "."
"The work will teach you how to do it."
"He who undertakes to be his own teacher has a fool for a pupil."
"Water quenches the thirst but does not teach you how to sing."
"The fault of another is a good teacher."
"Hold your children with your heart but teach them with your hands."
"Need teaches a plan."
"Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime."
"Eggs cannot teach a hen."
"When God wants to punish an idiot, He teaches them a few words of Hebrew."
"The mistakes of others are good teachers."
"He who does not research has nothing to teach."
"Experience is the best teacher."
"Falling teaches us to walk safely."
"Better untaught than ill taught."
"Teaching in youth is like carving in stone."
"Whatever you teach, be brief; what is quickly said the mind readily receives and faithfully retains, while everything superfluous runs over as from a full container. Who knows much says least."
"The world teaches you more than your supervisor."
"Diligence is a great teacher."
"The chicken sings what the cock teaches him."
"Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself."
"One may teach another to speak, but none can teach another to hold his peace."
"It’s not the fault of the parrot, but of the one who teaches him to talk."
"To do nothing teaches evil."
"Experience is the teacher of jesters and the intelligence of the wise."
"In a place without dogs they teach the cats to bark."
"He who does not teach his son a trade teaches him to steal."
"It is difficult to teach a cow to climb a tree."
"Teachers die, but books live on."
"The strictness of the teacher is better to bear than the prejudice of the father."
"The one who teaches is the giver of eyes."
"Who gives to me, teaches me to give."
"The world is a good teacher, but it charges a huge fee."
"Marriage teaches you to live alone."
"The young cannot teach tradition to the old."
"Teach your son in the front garden and your wife on the pillow."
"You know, you teach. You do not know, you learn."
"Once it was the parents who taught their children to talk; now the children teach their parents to keep quiet."
"Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart."
"A drop of wisdom is better than a sea of gold."
"Wisdom is in the head, not in the beard."
"Wisdom is lost in a fat man’s body."
"Beauty is the wisdom of women. Wisdom is the beauty of men."
"Wisdom is easy to carry but difficult to gather."
"Even from a foe a man may learn wisdom."
"Continual cheerfulness is a sign of wisdom."
"Better a drop of wisdom than an ocean of gold."
"That is good wisdom which is wisdom in the end."
"Better a good conscience without wisdom than wisdom without a good conscience."
"Gold without wisdom is but clay."
"Beauty without wisdom is like a flower in the mud."
"Wisdom is wealth."
"Do more things by wisdom than by force."
"When God punishes a land, he deprives it leaders of wisdom."
"The dying cannot leave their wisdom or experience to their heirs."
"The palace leads to fame, the market to fortune, and loneliness to wisdom."
"Maturity comes from wisdom not in the passing of years."
"Hunt in every jungle, for there is wisdom and good hunting in all of them."
"Rivalry of scholars advances wisdom."
"To the world wisdom is folly; to the wise the world is foolish."
"If you are filled with pride, then you will have no room for wisdom."
"Great doubts deep wisdom. Small doubts little wisdom."
"Knowledge is learning something every day. Wisdom is letting go of something every day."
"The hot sun melts away the snow; when anger comes, does wisdom go."
"Knowing just one word of wisdom is like knowing a hundred ordinary words."
"Wisdom consists of ten parts: nine parts silence, and one part a few words."
"From listening comes wisdom, and from speaking repentance."
"Wisdom is not like money to be tied up and hidden."
"You cannot buy wisdom abroad if there is none at home."
"Poor folk’s wisdom counts very little."
"Experience is the mother of wisdom."
"Deep doubts, deep wisdom; small doubts, little wisdom."
"Wealth gets in the way of wisdom."
"Wisdom does not come overnight."
"The greatest wisdom of all is kindness."
"Knowledge without wisdom is a load of books on the back of an ass."
"What use is wisdom when folly reigns?"
"The pine stays green in winter, wisdom in hardship."
"Silence is the fence around wisdom."
"Boasting begins where wisdom stops."
"Men can acquire knowledge, but not wisdom. Some of the greatest fools ever known were learned men."
"The beginning of wisdom is to call things by their right names."
"Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it."
"Only through suffering and sorrow do we acquire the wisdom not found in books."
"Useless wisdom is double foolishness."
"Under a ragged coat lies wisdom."
"Knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand."
"A lean agreement is better than a fat lawsuit."
"Better a friendly refusal than an unwilling consent."
"Rare is agreement between beauty and modesty."
"Agreement makes law."
"An agreement is a kind of debt."
"Two crocodiles cannot agree."
"Two experts never agree."
"Where there is negotiation, there is hope for agreement."
"Greeks only agree with each other about going to the toilet."
"When the cat and the mouse agree the farmer doesn’t stand a chance."
"He who cannot agree with his enemies is controlled by them."
"The wolf and the dog agree about the goat — which together they eat."
"They two agreed like two cats in a gutter."
"Sometimes even the intestine and the stomach disagree."
"Agreements should be clearly expressed, and chocolate should be served thick."
"Children of the same mother do not always agree."
"Setting the conditions before you make an agreement is better than having an argument in the middle of the work."
"One does not like hot, the other does not like cold; make it tepid to make an agreement."
"A polite devil is more agreeable than a rude saint."
"Work is our business; its success is God s."
"He who does not know what to do in his spare time is not a businessman."
"When you’re out of luck in the coffin making business, no one dies."
"In business partnerships and marriage partnerships, oh, the cheating that goes on."
"The art of doing business lies more in paying than in buying."
"He that is not eager to be pawed in cash is not a businessman."
"You will never know a man till you do business with him."
"There are no old friendships in business."
"Time is the soul of business."
"Do not leave to the morning the business of the evening."
"No iron is so strong that it cannot be melted down, and no business so dirty that can be fixed with money."
"Tell everybody your business and they will do it for you."
"Trust in God, but mind your own business."
"Great business is good; to sit and sip this glass is better."
"He who loves peace, minds his own business."
"Advertising is the driving force of business."
"Let every man mind his own business."
"The person who has never been cheated cannot be a good businessman."
"To open a business is very easy; to keep it open is very difficult."
"In business you need two Jews for one Greek, two Greeks for one Syrian and two Syrians for one Armenian."
"He who has no thirst has no business at the fountain."
"Friendship lasts but for a day, business connections forever."
"Live together like brothers and do business like strangers."
"He who has an egg in his pocket does not dance."
"The devil dances in an empty pocket"
"If the pocket is empty, the judge is deaf."
"With money in your pocket, you are wise, and you are handsome, and you sing well too."
"A book is a garden carried in the pocket."
"If your pocket gets empty, your faults will be many."
"A lawyer looks at you with one eye, but he looks at your pocket with two."
"The happiness in your pocket, don’t spend it all."
"The heaviest burden is an empty pocket."
"Good bargains empty your pockets."
"The hands of a lawyer are always in someone’s pocket."
"Profit is the brother of loss."
"Where profit is, loss is hiding nearby."
"It is difficult to scare people who think they will profit from dying."
"Accomplishment of purpose is better than making a profit."
"Better make profit out of manure than losses with musk."
"If there is any profit in partnership, two will share a woman."
"Stealing may bring profit, but hanging costs far more."
"There are only two things from which to choose: profit or loss."
"Moderate profits fill the purse."
"A man profits more by the sight of an idiot than by the orations of the learned."
"Cut your losses and let your profits run."
"Small profits are good if they come often."
"When there are two in a lawsuit only a third will profit from it."
"There is never trust without loss."
"When the tiger kills, the jackal profits."
"Whenever there is profit to be made then think of honesty."
"When a dead tree falls, the woodpeckers profit from his death."
"The fish sees the bait not the hook; a man sees not the danger — only the profit."
"Biggest profits mean gravest risks."
"Small profits and often, are better than large profits and seldom."
"Loaning money causes loss of memory."
"Adversity and loss make a man wise."
"A hundred years cannot repair a moment’s loss of honor."
"Better to die than to live on with a bad reputation."
"A good reputation is better than a golden girdle."
"When a door opens not to your knock, consider your reputation."
"The river’s reputation ends where the sea begins."
"When ten thousand soldiers lie rotting, the general’s reputation is enhanced."
"Sometimes it takes only an hour to get a reputation that lasts for a thousand years."
"Giving gifts to the rich is like pouring water into the sea."
"If you borrow some chaff from the rich man you have to repay him with wheat."
"The villain that becomes rich knows neither friends nor family."
"All water flows into the ocean or into the purse of the rich."
"There’s one law for the rich, and another for the poor."
"Always be patient with the rich and powerful."
"The devil gives even rich men presents."
"He who has a lot of money and no children is not rich; he who has many children and no money is not a pauper."
"Riches serve a wise man but command a fool."
"Rich people never know who their friends are."
"Economy is the wealth of the poor and the wisdom of the rich."
"If you cannot become rich, be the neighbor of a rich man."
"The rich never have to seek out their relatives."
"There is no pride like that of a beggar grown rich."
"One cannot count on riches."
"One cannot both feast and become rich."
"A rich man is either a scoundrel or the heir of a scoundrel."
"He who could foresee affairs three days in advance would be rich for thousands of years."
"Pity the stranger, even if he is rich."
"Rich is he who has no debts, fortunate he who lives without handicap."
"No one is so rich that he can do without a good neighbor."
"He who wants to bring home the riches of India, he must have them within himself."
"All riches come from the earth."
"If a man from humble beginnings gets rich, he will carry his umbrella at midnight."
"The beauty of a woman does not make a man richer."
"Having a good discussion is like having riches."
"The rich man has more relations than he knows about."
"The rich have many friends."
"Fools and obstinate men make lawyers rich."
"What makes you happy, makes you rich."
"If you give a gift to a rich man, the devil sniggers."
"The rich become deaf and the mighty blind."
"If you get rich, be in a dark corner when you jump for joy."
"A rich man has no need of character."
"If you would be rich in a year, you may be hanged in six months."
"When the Turk becomes richer he takes another wife."
"He who eats and drinks with the rich leaves the table hungry."
"Men will love each other as long as one is richer than the other."
"Brothers love each other when they are equally rich."
"Never judge a reindeer from close by when you got it from a rich man because you may find that some of the antlers are missing."
"The emperor is rich, but he cannot buy one extra year."
"The only thing that was missing at the rich man’s funeral was mourners."
"It is better to be born lucky than rich."
"Rich gamblers and old trumpeters are rare."
"Fools live poor to die rich."
"Honesty makes you rich, but she works slowly."
"As the person who has health is young, so the person who owes nothing is rich."
"Get what you can and keep what you have; that’s the way to get rich."
"You only lend to rich people."
"Riches: a dream in the night; fame: a gull floating on water."
"There is nothing better than a rich wife and a generous mother-in-law."
"When you are rich you suffer in a more comfortable way."
"There is no one who became rich because he broke a holiday, and no one who became fat because he broke a fast."
"If there is a rich man in the area three villages are ruined."
"Though the emperor be rich, he cannot buy one extra year."
"A man can’t get rich if he takes proper care of his family."
"Riches have wings."
"Deceive the rich and powerful, if you will, but don’t insult them."
"Never wrestle with a strong man nor bring a rich man to court."
"For rich and poor alike the womb is equally warm."
"To the patient man will come all the riches of the world."
"People lend only to the rich."
"Marry for money, my little sonny, a rich man’s joke is always funny."
"A rich child often sits in a poor mother’s lap."
"He who has nothing to lose is rich."
"The beggar is not afraid of the drawbacks of being rich."
"Knowledge is better than riches."
"No one is either rich or poor who has not helped himself to be so."
"He is rich who owes nothing."
"He that is afraid of the devil does not grow rich."
"A rich widow weeps in one eye and laughs with the other."
"The rich man never dances badly."
"Happy is the man without sickness. Rich is the man with no debts."
"The beggar that begs near another beggar will never be rich."
"If a woman gets rich she changes into a man."
"He who enjoys good health is rich, though he knows it not."
"He who would be rich should not collect money, but reduce his needs."
"If you must be a servant, serve the rich; if you must be a dog, let it be a temple dog."
"Physicians’ faults are covered with earth, and rich men’s with money."
"He is rich who knows when he has enough."
"The foolish sayings of a rich man pass for wise ones."
"Adversity makes a man wise, not rich."
"Poor or rich, death makes us all equal."
"When a man is not a lover in his twenties, not strong in his thirties, not rich in his forties and not wise in his fifties he will never be so."
"A rich man’s wooing need seldom be a long one."
"If you turn into a dog, be sure to choose a rich family."
"Riches add to the house, virtues to the man."
"Rich people eat gold and shit lead."
"After a rich man gets rich, his next ambition is to get richer."
"The court is most merciful when the accused is most rich."
"None is so rich as that he can throw away a friend."
"Misfortune sits on a rich man’s lap but grabs the throat of the pauper."
"The rich man may wear old clothes."
"Apply fitting ability in the fitting place."
"You have to be rich to be able to live like a poor man."
"The strongest among the disabled is the one who never forgets his disability."
"Behind every able man, there are always other able men."
"If you have money, men think you are wise, handsome, and able to sing like a bird."
"Cut down the tree that you are able to."
"Pray that you will never have to bear all that you are able to endure."
"Great abilities produce great vices as well as virtues."
"Courage is ten, nine is the ability to escape."
"A good storyteller must be able to lie a little."
"Able people can do more."
"Willing is a good man, but Able is a better one."
"Better safe than sorry."
"He is a sorry barber who has but one comb."
"The unfaithful woman has remorse, the faithful one has regret."
"I felt sorry for myself because I had no shoes — until I met a man who had no feet."
"It is a sorry house in which the cock is silent and the hen crows."
"He who serves the public has a sorry master."
"Confidence begets confidence."
"Believe that you have it, and you will have it."
"Whoever does not respect confidence will never find happiness in their path."
"He helps little that helps not himself."
"Freedom is a plateful of hard crusts."
"It is better to be a free man in a small house than a slave in a big one."
"He who has lost his freedom has nothing else to lose."
"Give your children too much freedom and you lose your own."
"Who mocks his chains will not be free."
"When money is taken freedom is forsaken."
"Rather free in a foreign place than a slave back home."
"Better to be a free dog than a caged lion."
"Better a free bird than a king in captivity."
"The child who loves freedom is the first victim of it."
"Four walls make a man free."
"It is better to work and be free than to be fed in captivity."
"Freedom does not lengthen life."
"He who wants what God wants of him will lead a free and happy life."
"He who takes a woman gives away his freedom."
"Who accepts from another sells his freedom."
"If a man does only what is required of him, he is a slave. If a man does more than is required of him, he is a free man."
"He who accepts favors, pawns his freedom."
"True happiness consists in making others happy."
"True happiness lies in giving it to others."
"Where there is laughter happiness likes to be."
"If it does not kill you, it will bring you happiness."
"Where there is love, there is happiness."
"Happiness has its roots — sorrow has its womb."
"There is no happiness; there are only moments of happiness."
"Real happiness consists in making others happy."
"One moment of intense happiness prolongs life by a thousand years."
"Happiness itself does not stay — only moments of happiness do."
"Who cleans up the dirt washes away happiness."
"Happiness you pay for is to be found everywhere."
"For some of us happiness comes while we sleep."
"Happiness that lasts too long spoils the heart."
"Today well lived makes every yesterday a dream of happiness, and every tomorrow a vision of hope. Look well, therefore, to this day."
"Happiness is like crystal — when it shines the most, it soon cracks."

"If you want happiness for an hour — take a nap. If you want happiness for a day — go fishing. If you want happiness for a month — get married. If you want happiness for a year — inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime — help someone else."
"To be able to curse once a day improves happiness and lengthens life."
"The happiness in your pocket, don’t spend it all."
"Happiness spring — cleans the heart."
"Where you are not — there is happiness."
"Happiness is like a sunbeam, which the least shadow intercepts, while adversity is often as the rain of spring."
"Woe is he who claims to have found happiness."
"Happiness flies away from those who want it most."
"The person who gets stuck on petty happiness will not attain great happiness."
"There is no winter without snow, no spring without sunshine, and no happiness without companions."
"Into the house where joy lives, happiness will gladly come."
"Happiness rarely keeps company with an empty stomach."
"Better an ounce of happiness than a pound of gold."
"Silence is the interpreter of happiness."
"Happiness opens the arms and closes the eyes."
"When ambition ends, happiness begins."
"While we pursue happiness, we flee from contentment."
"Yesterday is but a dream, tomorrow but a vision. But today well lived makes every yesterday a dream of happiness, and every tomorrow a vision of hope. Look well, therefore, to this day."
"Who ever does not respect confidence will never find happiness in their path."
"Happiness and glass break easily."
"Happiness is not a horse; you cannot harness it."
"Happiness does not come from happiness itself, but from the journey towards achieving it."
"No one is happier than he who believes in his happiness."
"God is a father, happiness is a stepfather."
"Happiness does not give, it only lends."
"Kiss the hand of your enemy if you cannot chop it off: Envy has no rest."
"From the well of envy, only a fool drinks the water."
"It is better to have a husband without love than jealous."
"A neighbor’s eye is full of jealousy."
"A jealous woman will set a whole house on fire."
"If envy were a fever, all the world would be ill."
"Envy shoots at others and wounds itself."
"Jealousy is nourished by doubt."
"Envy eats nothing but its own heart."
"A loving man, a jealous man."
"Envy sees the sea but not the rocks."
"Compete, don’t envy."
"Love is too rare to be lost on jealousy."
"Envy does not enter empty houses."
"They that envy others are their inferiors."
"The best way to keep loyalty in a man’s heart is to keep money in his purse."
"Masters who sacrifice for servants will receive the gift of loyalty."
"The most faithful mirror is an old friend."
"Who finds a faithful friend, finds a treasure."
"There are three faithful friends: an old wife, an old dog, and ready money."
"In peace be faithful; in war be valiant."
"No matter how sharp it is, a knife will never cut it’s own handle."
"Great villainy is often called loyalty."
"The unfaithful woman has remorse, the faithful one has regret."
"What is bad luck for one man is good luck for another."
"Change yourself, and your luck will change."
"Luck is loaned, not owned."
"Luck that lasts is always suspected."
"Luck sometimes visits a fool, but never sits down with him."
"You have to take it as it happens, but you should try to make it happen the way you want to take it."
"You don’t need intelligence to have luck, but you do need luck to have intelligence."
"You can give a piece of advice, but not good luck along with that."
"When your luck deserts you, even cold food burns."
"When luck joins in the game, cleverness scores double."
"When ill luck falls asleep, let none wake her."
"When God throws the dice, they are loaded."
"To wait for luck is the same as waiting for death."
"To be lucky you need a little wit."
"Throw a lucky man in the sea, and he will come up with a fish in his mouth."
"Third time lucky."
"There is no one luckier than he who thinks himself so."
"There is no luck except where there is discipline."
"The person afraid of bad luck will never know good."
"The more you know, the luckier you get."
"The lucky fellow loses his wife; the unlucky fellow loses his horse."
"The luckiest dies in his cradle."
"The luck of idle men sits next to them."
"The day you decide to do it is your lucky day."
"Substance is not enough, accident is also required."
"Seven trades but no luck."
"See a pin and pick it up, all the day you’ll have good luck; see a pin and let it lie, you’ll want a pin before you die."
"Parents can give their children everything except good luck."
"One ounce of good luck is better than a ton of brains."
"Nothing falls from heaven."
"Lucky at cards, unlucky in love."
"Luck stops at the door and inquires whether prudence is within."
"Luck seeks those who flee and flees those who seek it."
"Luck never gives; it only lends."
"Luck is the residue of design."
"Luck is the idol of the idle."
"Luck is like having a rice dumpling fly into your mouth."
"Luck is infatuated with the efficient."
"It is better to be born lucky than rich."
"In bad luck, hold out; in good luck, hold in."
"If you were born lucky, even your rooster will lay eggs."
"If you are looking for bad luck, you will soon find it."
"If bad luck is asleep you must not awaken it."
"He that has the luck leads the bride to church."
"Guests bring good luck with them."
"Good luck comes in slender currents, misfortune in a rolling tide."
"Good luck beats early rising."
"Good looking and good luck don’t always walk the same road."
"Go and wake up your luck."
"Fortune is with you for an hour and against you for ten!"
"Each man’s character shapes his fortunes."
"Better an ounce of luck than a pound of gold."
"Bad luck is fertile."
"Bad luck for one man is good luck for another."
"Don’t measure your neighbor’s honesty by your own."
"He that does not bring up his son to some honest calling and employment, brings him up to be a thief."
"An honest man is the noblest work of God."
"Honesty is like an icicle–if once it melts that is the end of it."
"If you really want honesty, then don’t ask questions you don’t really want the answer to."
"In the absence of honest men, they made my father mayor."
"Act honestly, and answer boldly."
"An honest man is not the worse because a dog barks at him."
"A nod of an honest man is enough."
"I know they are all honest men, but my cloak is nowhere to be found."
"When thieves fall out, honest men get their goods back."
"Faith and dishonesty are other words for uselessness."
"Stupidity begins with honesty."
"A lock is meant only for honest men."
"Don’t call a man honest just because he never had the chance to steal."
"Do not trust a person who claims to be honest, and never trust exaggerated friendliness."
"Slander cannot destroy an honest man: when the flood recedes the rock is there."
"Whenever there is profit to be made then think of honesty."
"God lives in an honest heart."
"An honest man’s word is as good as the king’s."
"Locks keep out only the honest."
"The thief who has no opportunity to steal thinks he is an honest man."
"You are not being honest if you burn your tongue and don’t tell everyone else that the soup is hot."
"Nothing resembles an honest man more than a cheat."
"The poorhouse is filled with honest people."
"Better an honest slap in the face than an insincere kiss."
"Honesty is the poor man’s pork and the rich man’s pudding."
"A clean mouth and an honest hand will take a man through any land."
"The thief who isn’t caught is an honest salesman."
"A thread will tie an honest man better than a chain a rogue."
"An honest man’s word is his bond."
"Beauty without honesty is like a rose without perfume."
"There are such things as false truths and honest lies."
"Honest men fear neither the light nor the dark."
"You can only be honest if you are well fed."
"He is not honest who has burned his tongue and does not tell the company the soup is hot."
"Honesty makes you rich, but she works slowly."
"When it thunders the thief becomes honest."
"Where rich people can make honest money, poor people have to steal."
"A dying man discovers the honesty with which he was born."
"Short lived pleasure is the parent of pain."
"Love, pain, and money cannot be kept secret. They soon betray themselves."
"A hundred "no’s" are less painful than one insincere "yes.""
"No pleasure without pain."
"An hour of pain is as long as a day of pleasure."
"Better pain in your purse than in your heart."
"The pain is sometimes preferable to the treatment."
"To fall is not painful for those who fly low."
"Jealousy is a pain that seeks what caused it."
"Jealousy is a pain seeking its cause."
"One pleasure, a thousand pains."
"Revenge is a confession of pain."
"Painless poverty is better than embittered wealth."
"If you wake up in the morning and feel no pain it is to be feared that you died in the night."
"When the pain has passed one forgets the medicine."
"He that is uneasy at every little pain is never without some ache."
"That which is escaped now is pain to come."
"Sorrow for a husband is like a pain in the elbow, sharp and short."
"You eat an egg, but you don’t understand how painful it was for the chicken."
"He who begins and does not finish loves their pains."
"A pain in the foot is soon forgotten — a pain in the head is not."
"He who looks up too much gets a pain in the neck."
"Where there is love, there is pain."
"A man can endure the worst pain — of others."
"In a good word there are three winters’ warmth; in one malicious word there is pain for six frosty months."
"Who suffers from love, feels no pain."
"Pain is easier to endure than an itch."
"The most useful holy war is the one fought against your own passions."
"If Heaven made him, earth can find some use for him."
"Govern your passions, or they will govern you."
"The virtue of a woman does not go deep but her passion knows no limit."
"Our passions are the winds that propel our vessel. Our reason is the pilot that steers her. Without winds the vessel would not move and without a pilot she would be lost."
"The happiness in this life does not consist of being devoid of passion, but mastering them."
"There is no repentance after death."
"Regretting the past is like chasing after the wind."
"The unfaithful woman has remorse, the faithful one has regret."
"All of the Earth’s treasures can’t bring back a lost moment."
"Perform good deeds; you will not regret them."
"A few moments of misplaced values can mean a lifetime of regret."
"The first half of life is spent in longing for the second, the second half in regretting the first."
"It’s no shame to look into the warm spring sun and regret a lost limb."
"He who believes his wife too much will regret it in the end."
"Remorse is worse than a beating."
"Better to be safe than sorry."
"Haste and hurry can only bear children with many regrets along the way."
"A gypsy only tells the truth once in his life but he regrets it afterwards."
"One moment’s error becomes a lifetime of sadness."
"Unhappiness can be a bridge to happiness."
"One man’s happiness is another man’s sadness."
"A sad bride makes a glad wife."
"Marriage without lovemaking means sad consequences and sorrow."
"A satisfied man is happy even if he is poor; a dissatisfied man is sad even if he is rich."
"It’s a sad house where the hen crows louder than the cock."
"A smiling face dispels unhappiness."
"It’s better to lie a little than to be unhappy."
"Only he who understands is really sad."
"There is never trust without loss."
"In God we trust; all others pay cash."
"Try and trust will move mountains."
"Do not trust a person who claims to be honest, and never trust exaggerated friendliness."
"Don’t trust the smile of your opponent."
"Trust me, but look to thyself."
"Trust in God, but tie your camel."
"Don’t trust your wife until she has borne you ten sons."
"If someone puts their trust in you, don’t sever it."
"Trust your best friend as you would your worst enemy."
"After I saw what my mother did, I will never trust a widow."
"Do not stand in a dangerous place trusting in miracles."
"Eyes trust themselves, ears trust others."
"Never trust overmuch to a new friend or an old enemy."
"Never trust a woman who mentions her virtue."
"Never trust the man who tells you all his troubles but keeps from you all his joys."
"It is better to trust the eyes rather than the ears."
"Trust is the mother of exasperation."
"Don’t trust the horses if they run away, or the whores if they repent."
"He who saves up for another day has no trust in God."
"Trusting in wealth is like looking for feathers on turtles."
"Expect trust from a dog but not from a woman."
"Never trust a fool with a sword."
"Don’t trust in fortune until you are in heaven."
"He who trusts is happy; the doubter is wise."
"A fool is someone who trusts another fool."
"Few are fit to be entrusted with themselves."
"Don’t forget to distrust."
"It is an equal failing to trust everybody, and to trust nobody."
"Trust not the praise of a friend nor the contempt of an enemy."
"Watch out for a bad woman and never trust a good one."
"He who knows his heart mistrusts his eyes."
"Never trust the advice of a man in difficulty."
"If you trust before you try, you may repent before you die."
"Mistrust is the mother of certainty."
"A jack of both sides, is before long, trusted by nobody, and abused by both parties."
"If you conduct yourself properly, then fear no one."
"Who seeks adventures finds blows."
"Who ventures to lend, loses money and friend."
"Venture all; see what fate brings."
"Venture a small fish to catch a much greater one."
"Try the ice before you venture on it."
"Who seeks adventures finds blows."
"Who ventures to lend, loses money and friend."
"Venture all; see what fate brings."
"Venture a small fish to catch a much greater one."
"Try the ice before you venture on it."
"Visits always give pleasure — if not the arrival, the departure."
"You arrive Mr. Big Shot but leave Mr. Nobody."
"Punishment is a cripple, but it arrives."
"You may never die before death arrives."
"The horse that arrives early gets good drinking water."
"It’s better to arrive on time than to be invited."
"He who arrives too late finds the plate turned over."
"Who arrives in the darkness departs as night falls."
"The buffalo that arrive late will have to drink muddy water and eat dried grass."
"He who is in a hurry always arrives late."
""We have rowed well," said the flea as the fishing boat arrives at its mooring."
"You can’t drive straight on a twisting lane."
"A tree never hits an automobile except in self-defense."
"The camel and his driver — each has his own plan."
"A mule driver is not aware of the stink of his animals."
"A lawyer and a wagon wheel must be well greased."
"The wagon rests in winter, the sleigh in summer, the horse never."
"A wheel that turns gathers no rust."
"He who rides upon an ass cannot help but smell its gas!"
"An army is driven back by courage and not by insults, however many."
"Badly oiled wheels will squeak."
"Before God and the bus driver we are all equal."
"There is no flying without wings."
"God made low branches for birds that cannot fly so well."
"Falling hurts least those who fly low."
"No need to teach an eagle to fly."
"Birds of a color fly to the same place."
"No matter how high a bird can fly, it still has to look for food on the ground."
"When a heart is on fire, sparks always fly out of the mouth."
"Even an eagle will not fly higher than the sun."
"Words have no wings but they can fly many thousands of miles."
"Flying birds have no master."
"Fish and guests smell at three days old."
"Money is like a guest: it comes today, leaves tomorrow."
"If you are a host to your guest, be a host to his dog also."
"A daily guest is a great thief in the kitchen."
"A guest sees more in an hour than the host in a year."
"The guest who seeks special attention muddies the host’s tea."
"The guest who outstays his fellow guests loses his overcoat."
"A guest for a day is welcome the whole year."
"The place of an uninvited guest is behind the door."
"A guest who breaks the dishes of his host is not soon forgotten."
"Every guest hates the others, and the host hates them all."
"The delicacy of the feast is the learned guest."
"The earth is a host who kills his guests."
"Guests bring good luck with them."
"A constant guest is never welcome."
"The life of a guest is seven days."
"A guest will not know what fasting means."
"The first day a guest, the second day a guest, the third day a calamity."
"Guests always have nice backs."
"You can’t escape death and guests."
"He who is not friendly towards a good guest will never have one."
"Treat thoughts as guests and wishes as children."
"He who is a guest in two houses, starves."
"Visits always give pleasure — if not the arrival, the departure."
"A guest hammers a nail in the wall even if he stays only one night."
"In the hotel of decisions the guests sleep well."
"A person is a guest for one or two days, but becomes an intruder on the third."
"If your guest becomes a cook, your larder will soon be empty."
"Ears are usually uninvited guests."
"A great ship asks for deep waters."
"It is good sailing with wind and tide."
"To a man wine is like water is to the boat; it can carry him or guzzle him up."
"You are not a fully fledged sailor unless you have sailed under full sail."
"Two captains sink a ship."
"If you are in a boat you are more afraid of fire than you are of water."
"Don’t buy a boat that is under water."
"After the ship has sunk, everyone knows how she might have been saved."
"Loose lips sink ships."
"Sailors get to know each other better when there is a storm."
"There is no wind that blows right for the sailor who doesn’t know where the harbor is."
"One foot cannot stand on two boats."
"Help thy brother’s boat across, and lo! thine own has reached the shore."
"No matter how big the sea may be, sometimes two ships meet."
"He who plunders with a little boat is a pirate; he who plunders with a fleet is a conqueror."
"The ship that will not obey the helm will have to obey the rocks."
"A man without money is like a boat without sails."
"The boat sails by, the shore remains."
"Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors."
"When the boat reaches mid-stream, it is too late to stop the leak."
"The water that a ship sails on is the same water that swallows it up."
"A boat that is not tied up will drift along with the stream."
"It is safest to sail within reach of the shore."
"In calm water every ship has a good captain."
"Fear blows wind into your sails."
"Don’t sail out further than you can row back."
"One should learn to sail in all winds."
"Better lose the anchor than the whole ship."
"We cannot direct the wind, but we can adjust the sails."
"If there is a wave there must be a wind."
"Whenever the water rises, the boat will rise too."
"A ship on the beach is a lighthouse to the sea."
"Red sky at night, sailor’s delight. Red sky at morning, sailors take warning."
"Sailors have a port in every storm."
"Both the fast and the slow will meet each other on the ferry boat."
"Too many hands will row the boat up a mountain."
"Hoist your sail when the wind is fair."
"A boat stands firmer with two anchors."
"Nodding the head does not row the boat."
"Our passions are the winds that propel our vessel. Our reason is the pilot that steers her. Without winds the vessel would not move and without a pilot she would be lost."
"Don’t build a new ship out of old wood."
"If you are going to fight, pray once; if you are going to sail, pray twice; if you are getting married, then pray thrice."
"A ship and a woman are ever repairing."
""We have rowed well," said the flea as the fishing boat arrives at its mooring."
"You can’t load a small boat with heavy cargo."
"Who is known as an early riser may sleep longer."
"Preventing someone from falling is better than helping him get up."
"There is no economy in going to bed early to save candles if the result is twins."
"The early bird gets the worm."
"You must decide where you are going in the evening, if you intend to leave early in the morning."
"Go and wake up your luck."
"The chicken also knows when it’s morning, but still watches the mouth of the cock."
"Sleep with a woman and she will make sure you wake up."
"Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise."
"If your neighbor is an early riser, you too will become one."
"Life is just like a dream — but don’t wake me."
"If you get up one more time than you fall you will make it through."
"Paris is owned by the early risers."
"The hardest person to wake up is the person who is already awake."
"If someone is coming to kill you, get up early and kill him first."
"However early you get up you cannot hasten the dawn."
"He who gets a name for early rising can stay in bed until midday."
"Good luck beats early rising."
"In the morning be first up, and in the evening last to go to bed, for they that sleep catch no fish."
"The horse that arrives early gets good drinking water."
"If you rise too early, the dew will wet you."
"You must decide where you are going in the evening, if you intend to leave early in the morning."
"Never rely on the glory of the morning or the smiles of your mother-in-law."
"A misty morning does not signify a cloudy day."
"An hour in the morning is worth two in the evening."
"For age and want save while you may, no morning sun lasts a whole day."
"Evening promises are like butter: morning comes, and it’s all melted."
"In the morning of life, work; in the mid day give council; in the evening, pray."
"Red sky at morning, sailors take warning."
"Choose your lodging before dark and leave before the morning dew."
"Not the day only, but all things have their morning."
"The morning hour has gold in its mouth."
"Morning will still come with or without the crowing of the cock."
"In the morning be first up, and in the evening last to go to bed, for they that sleep catch no fish."
"The darkness of night cannot stop the light of morning."
"The chicken also knows when it’s morning, but still watches the mouth of the cock."
"The person who doesn’t scatter the morning dew will not comb gray hairs."
"No lamp burns till morning."
"You will not dare mistreat the face you see in the morning."
"Do not leave to the morning the business of the evening."
"The hen that cackles in the evening lays no eggs in the morning."
"Morning rain and women’s tears dry as fast as each other."
"Lose an hour in the morning, chase it all day."
"He who spends a night with a chicken will cackle in the morning."
"The world is nonsense: what looks beautiful in the morning looks ugly in the evening."
"Day has its eyes, night has its ears."
"Never praise life in front of death, nor the beautiful day in front of night."
"Last night I made a thousand plans, but this morning I went my old way."
"A man is old when he takes the whole night to do what he used to do all night long."
"The night rinses what the day has soaped."
"Do not blame the sun for the darkness of the night."
"Clear conscience never fears midnight knocking."
"The nights are short for him who married late in life."
"The night walks the same road as the dream."
"Midsummer night is not long but it sets many cradles rocking."
"It is never later than midnight."
"Red sky at night, sailor’s delight. Red sky at morning, sailors take warning."
"The darkness of night cannot stop the light of morning."
"The night is the king of the shadows."
"Who arrives in the darkness departs as night falls."
"Nights of pleasure are short."
"If there are no nightingales one must settle for owls."
"One night with an ugly woman and one day in the mountains both are like an eternity."
"He who led me in the night, will be thanked by me at daybreak."
"He who does not lose his way by night will not lose his way by day."
"The gates of hell are always open, even at midnight."
"When night falls the face of the wolf lights up."
"A decision made at night may be changed in the morning."
"Darkness and night are mothers of thought."
"The day will wipe out all the promises of the night."
"Many seek good nights and waste good days."
"Better to sit all night than to go to bed with a dragon."
"To spend the night in anger is better than to spend it repenting."
"If you carry treasure, don’t travel at night."
"If you go out a lot at night, you will probably meet ghosts."
"You can make the dream bigger than the night."
"The day did not know that night had fallen."
"Night is the mother of advice."
"No matter how long the night, the day is sure to come."
"For a bad night, a mattress of wine."
"Better a night full of anger than a night full of repentance."
"The loss of one night’s sleep is followed by ten days of inconvenience."
"Boast during the day; be humble at night."
"Curse your wife at evening, sleep alone at night."
"Four things come not back. The spoken word, the sped arrow, the past life, ad the neglected opportunity."
"You can be cautious about the future but not the past."
"Words of snow, which fell last year."
"A book is a good friend when it lays bare the errors of the past."
"Regretting the past is like chasing after the wind."
"Living in the past has one thing going for it; it’s cheaper!"
"Patience, money and time bring all things to past."
"The future is for those who know how to wait."
"When you talk about future happenings the devil starts to laugh."
"Men see only the present; heaven sees the future."
"The past is for God, the future for the Tsars."
"Don’t try to make predictions — especially those concerning the future."
"All the past died yesterday; the future is born today."
"You can be cautious about the future but not the past."
"The future struggles against being mastered."
"He who predicts the future lies, even if he tells the truth."
"The past is the future of the present."
"Learn about the future by looking at the past."
"If men could foresee the future, they would still behave as they do now."
"When we have nothing to worry about we are not doing much, and not doing much may supply us with plenty of future worries."
"May you have a bright future — as the chimney sweep said to his son."
"No year has two summers."
"If summer had a mother, she would weep at summer’s passing."
"Winter will ask you what you did during the summer."
"It is not summer until the crickets sing."
"The summer comes and kisses the child, the winter comes and kills it."
"You cannot build a house for last year’s summer."
"You have summer and you have winter — why, then, be in a hurry?"
"A life without love is like a year without summer."
"Midsummer night is not long but it sets many cradles rocking."
"Confess you were wrong yesterday; it will show you are wise today."
"Yesterday’s flowers are today’s dreams."
"Yesterday’s drunkenness will not quench today’s thirst."
"A proverb is the child of experience."
"The foolish sayings of a rich man pass for wise ones."
"Proverbs are the lamp of speech."
"Proverbs are the lamp of speech."
"A country can be judged by the quality of its proverbs."
"All the past died yesterday; the future is born today."
"Yesterday, today and tomorrow — these are the three days of man."
"Yesterday is but a dream, tomorrow but a vision. But today well lived makes every yesterday a dream of happiness, and every tomorrow a vision of hope. Look well, therefore, to this day."
"The cuckoo comes in April, and stays the month of May; sings a song at midsummer, and then goes away."
"No matter how much snow falls, it won’t remain there all the way till summer."
"One swallow does not make a summer."
"When men speak of the future, the gods laugh."
"Every future is not far away."
"A sponge to wipe away the past; a rose to sweeten the present; a kiss to greet the future."
"No matter her past, when a chambermaid marries a lord she becomes a lady."
"The past is for God, the future for the Tsars."
"All the past died yesterday; the future is born today."
"Even the night has ears."
"If the king says that it is night in the middle of the day, look up at the stars."
"Wait until it is night before saying it has been a fine day."
"A man combs his hair every morning — why not his heart?"
"The morning is wiser than the evening."
"Even the most beautiful morning cannot bring back the evening."
"If you wake up in the morning and feel no pain it is to be feared that you died in the night."
"The opportunity that God sends does not wake up him who is asleep."
"The hungry fowl wakes early."
"It is good to swim near a boat."
"Raise your sail one foot and you get ten feet of wind."
"The boat follows the helm, the woman follows her husband."
"Abuse of hospitality breaks the bridge."
"Treat your guest as a guest for two days — then on the third day give him a hoe."
"A merry host makes merry guests."
"You cannot fly with wings made of butter."
"You cannot prevent the birds of sorrow from flying over your head, but you can prevent them from building nests in your hair."
"Don’t try to fly before you have wings."
"A hundred wagon loads of thoughts will not pay a single ounce of debt."
"Your wife and your wheelbarrow — lend them to no one."
"Needs must when the devil drives."
"Let us hurry and finish up the food; when visitors arrive, the meal will be over."
"He who walks alone shall surely arrive first."
"If someone says "There is a wedding ceremony in the clouds," then the women would soon arrive with their ladders."
"Nothing ventured, nothing gained."
"Deep swimmers and high climbers usually don’t die in their beds."
"Adventures are to the adventurous."
"Nothing ventured, nothing gained."
"Deep swimmers and high climbers usually don’t die in their beds."
"Adventures are to the adventurous."
"Mistrust before you trust."
"He who mistrusts most should be trusted least."
"Trust in God, but mind your own business."
"It is a sad situation for a son-in-law when his mother-in-law praises him."
"If the heart is sad, tears will flow."
"Sadness is a valuable treasure — only discovered in people you love."
"He who hesitates, regrets."
"Regret, like a tail, comes at the end."
"After a foolish deed comes remorse."
"A man without passion is no son of Adam."
"Who is strong? He who subdues his passions."
"Passion is the trigger of success."
"Where a man feels pain he lays his hand."
"A pain that pricks the conscience is more effective than a lot of whiplashes."
"Time heals old pain, while it creates new ones."
"The first step toward greatness is to be honest."
"When con men meet a legitimately honest man, they are so bewildered that they consider him a greater con man than themselves."
"An honest man does not make himself a dog for the sake of a bone."
"After bad luck comes good fortune."
"A person does not seek luck; luck seeks the person."
"A lucky person is someone who plants pebbles and harvests potatoes."
"Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful."
"The powerful are never faithful."
"Duty before devotion."
"If envy would burn, there would be no use for wood."
"The enemy’s own punishment is his envy."
"After honor and state follow envy and hate."
"An inflated idea can burst the bubble of your happiness."
"With happiness comes intelligence to the heart."
"There is no other happiness but peace."
"The saving man becomes the free man."
"A country without freedom is like a prisoner with shackled hands."
"They are not free who drag their chains behind them."
"Many promises impair confidence."
"When there is no enemy within, the enemies outside cannot hurt you."
"Do not be excessively timid or excessively confident."
"Repentant tears wash out the stain of guilt."
"Age is a sorry travelling companion."

category: not the fastest horse can catch a word spoken in anger. ~chinese

text: "He who is unable to dance blames it in the stony yard."
"He who wants a fire must be able to bear smoke."
"To be willing is to be able."
"Work makes you into a hunchback and then rich."
"When a Bulgar gets rich he builds himself another house."
"An old man telling lies is like a rich man stealing."
"The soldiers’ blood, the general’s reputation."
"Of a dead leopard we keep the skin, of man his reputation."
"The reputation of a man is like his shadow; it sometimes follows and somtimes precedes him, it is sometimes longer and sometimes shorter than his natural size."
"What has been lost is safe."
"A foolish man may be known by six things: Anger without cause, speech without profit, change without progress, inquiry without object, putting trust in a stranger, and mistaking foes for friends."
"Caution minimizes loss."
"The longest road is the one that leads to your pocket."
"You can’t keep a word of thanks in your pocket."
"The rich man carries God in his pocket, the poor man in his heart."
"When pleasure interferes with business, give up business."
"A partner in the business will not put an obstacle to it."
"Dine with a friend but do not do business with him."
"An enemy will agree, but a friend will argue."
"Theologians, dogs, and singers always disagree."
"Law’s costly — take a pint and agree."
"If a rich man eats a snake people say, "This is wisdom!" If a poor man eats a snake people say, "This is folly!""
"Economy is the wealth of the poor and the wisdom of the rich."
"A miser’s money takes the place of wisdom."
"You can’t teach old dog new tricks."
"Necessity is a great teacher."
"No need to teach an eagle to fly."
"Married couples who love each other tell each other a thousand things without talking."
"Cheap To talk goodness is not good… only to do it is."
"A man has two ears and one mouth; he therefore should listen more than he talks."
"Stupid solutions that succeed are still stupid solutions."
"Stupid people always think they are right. Wise people listen to advice."
"Two times good — one time stupid."
"He who leaves a good name does not die poor."
"Give a dog a tasty name and eat him."
"Vices creep into our hearts under the name of virtue."
"A man should go on living — if only to satisfy his curiosity."
"You can teach a student a lesson for a day; but if you can teach him to learn by creating curiosity, he will continue the learning process as long as he lives."
"Keep your curiosity sharp, and you will never become too old to appreciate life."
"A picture is worth ten thousand words."
"A pessimist is a well-informed optimist."
"A man with two ears can be supported by two words."
"The shortest answer is doing."
"I know nothing about it; I haven’t seen it; that is the best answer."
"In every woman there is a Queen. Speak to the Queen and the Queen will answer."
"Men must sew up tears with gentleness."
"Nothing wipes your tears away but your own hand."
"Don’t be misled by the tears of a beggar."
"A chicken that hatches a crocodile’s eggs is looking for trouble."
"A trouble shared is a trouble halved."
"He who marries a beauty marries trouble."
"Men must sew up tears with gentleness."
"Nothing wipes your tears away but your own hand."
"Don’t be misled by the tears of a beggar."
"Only through suffering and sorrow do we acquire the wisdom not found in books."
"You have to suffer a lot or die young."
"Think late, suffer soon."
"Forgiveness is more satisfying than revenge."
"Revenge does not long remain un revenged."
"The revenge that is postponed is not forgotten."
"Seek the brave in prison and the stupid among the clergy."
"Old thieves make good jailers."
"Don’t be so clever; cleverer ones than you are in jail."
"When a king makes a mistake, all the people suffer."
"Do not mistake a goat’s beard for a fine stallion’s tail."
"In a group of many words, there is bound to be a mistake somewhere in them."
"Loneliness is a nest for the thoughts."
"Solitude is full of God."
"The lonely person is at home everywhere."
"To try and fail is not laziness."
"Men learn little from success, but much from failure."
"Failures are but mileposts on the road to success."
"He who eats alone chokes alone."
"Two is good, one alone cannot wash his back."
"One man alone is prey to the wolf."
"The bear dances but the tamer collects the money."
"An old cat will never learn to dance."
"Love teaches even asses to dance."
"Luck never gives; it only lends."
"The best throw of the dice is to throw them away."
"If you must play, decide upon three things at the start: the rules of the game, the stakes, and the quitting time."
"Do not make jokes that cost more than a ruble."
"A poor joke must invent its own laughter."
"A joke is often the hole through which truth whistles."
"Music helps not the toothache."
"A silent mouth is musical."
"Heavenly music is interpreted differently by everyone."
"Loving and singing are not to be forced."
"I can’t sing but I am a musicologist."
"Until spring comes, nightingales do not sing."
"Virtue consists of action."
"Vision without action is a daydream. Action without vision is a nightmare."
"When deeds speak, words are nothing."
"The world would not make a racehorse of a donkey."
"Slow but sure wins the race."
"On your own donkey it is quicker than on someone else’s racehorse."
"Courage cannot be bought at the inn."
"An army is driven back by courage and not by insults, however many."
"Alertness and courage are life’s shield."
"One may go a long way after one is tired."
"You’ve got to do your own growing, not matter how tall your grandfather was."
"If a man plants melons he will reap melons; if he sows beans, he will reap beans."
"Take heed you do not find what you do not seek."
"If your strength is small, don’t carry heavy burdens. If your words are worthless, don’t give advice."
"Nothing is too difficult you only need to know how."
"With hard work, you can get fire out of a stone."
"The wicked work harder to preach hell than the righteous do to get to heaven."
"It is hard work to be the mother of many pigs."
"Men never moan over the opportunities lost to do good, only the opportunities to be bad."
"Opportunities come but do not linger."
"Never kiss an opportunity with a dirty mouth."
"The camel and his driver — each has his own plan."
"The day you are leaving is not the time to start your preparations."
"It’s a bad plan that cannot be changed."
"If you stop every time a dog barks, your road will never end."
"It’s when things get rough and you don’t quit that success comes."
"Many people quit looking for work when they find a job."
"God sells knowledge for labor, honor for risk."
"Danger can never by overcome without taking risks."
"Nothing is gained without taking risks."
"What is not urgent must be done quickly in order to take care of the urgent things calmly."
"Saying is one thing, and doing another."
"Something done at the wrong time should be regarded as not done."
"Where the cattle stand together, the lion lies down hungry."
"Two lovers in the rain have no need of an umbrella."
"For the friendship of two, the patience of one is required."
"Don’t pour away your water on the strength of a mirage."
"If youth but had the knowledge and old age the strength."
"Cunning is better than strength."
"No pillows so soft as God’s promise."
"Nothing weights lighter than a promise."
"There is no greater fraud than a promise not kept."
"Man has responsibility, not power."
"Use power to curb power."
"The devil tempts but doesn’t force."
"Three are powerful: the Pope, the king, and the man who has nothing."
"None are more haughty than a common place person raised to power."
"Never give a sword to a fool or power to an unjust man."
"A powerful man has big ears."
"Stupidity is a force unto itself."
"Every tree feels the force of the wind."
"The power of the crocodile is in the water."
"Go with the powerful and people will kneel before you."
"Persuasion is better than force."
"Unless a serpent devour a serpent it will not become a dragon. Unless one power absorb another, it will not become great."
"Advertising is the driving force of business."
"A powerful friend becomes a powerful enemy."
"The word of a powerful man is the truth."
"If power is for sale, sell your mother to buy it. You can always buy her back again."
"The raggy colt often made a powerful horse."
"He who is afraid of a thing gives it power over him."
"Dogs that fight each other will join forces against the wolf."
"You can’t use your hand to force the sun to set."
"Community is not made by force."
"Force without forecast is to little avail."
"The tree breaks that takes all the force of the wind."
"No matter how hidden a force is, it will attract some kind of resistance."
"Cunning is better than force."
"A little subtleness is better than a lot of force."
"Force is that which rules the actions without regulating the will."
"Every tree feels the force of the wind."
"Persuasion is better than force."
"Advertising is the driving force of business."
"Dogs that fight each other will join forces against the wolf."
"Laugh at the rice and you will weep for the lentil."
"A fool laughs at himself."
"A maid who laughs is half taken."
"The lame man laughs at the blind."
"They are not all friends who laugh with you."
"If you tell the truth too early, you are laughed at — too late and you are stoned."
"Who laughs at you also cries for you."
"Men laugh with their heart, women only with their mouth."
"Be resolved and the thing is done."
"If you are determined — just do it!"
"With a resolute heart, a mouse can lift an elephant. Spreading the news is also multiplying it."
"An ass does not appreciate fruit compote."
"Do good and throw it into the sea — if it is not appreciated by an ungrateful man, it will be appreciated by God."
"Only when a new government comes to power do you learn to appreciate the values of the old one."
"He who boasts of his accomplishments will heap ridicule."
"A man who cannot tolerate small ills can never accomplish great things."
"Birth, ancestry, and that which you yourself have not achieved can hardly be called your own."
"To talk without thinking is to shoot without aiming."
"Talking without thinking is shooting without aiming."
"Taking aim for too long can ruin your eyes."
"He is guilty who is not at home."
"You travel on until you return home; you live on until you return to earth."
"Affairs of the home should not be discussed in the public square."
"Away from home the girl picks forbidden fruit."
"It is easier to wage war with wise enemies than be at peace with foolish friends."
"The heart of a fool is in his mouth and the mouth of the wise man is in his heart."
"The fool does what he can’t avoid, the wise man avoids what he can’t do."
"Every meeting is the beginning of a good-bye."
"Only the mountains never meet."
"To leave is to die a little."
"What has been lost is safe."
"A foolish man may be known by six things: Anger without cause, speech without profit, change without progress, inquiry without object, putting trust in a stranger, and mistaking foes for friends."
"Caution minimizes loss."
"When an ant gets wings, it loses its head."
"When a thief finds nothing to steal he will steal a dagger made of sand."
"The lucky fellow loses his wife, the unlucky fellow loses his horse."
"A smile is like tight underwear — it makes your cheeks go up."
"Cover your mouth when you cough. never cover it when you smile."
"Smiling is my favorite exercise!"
"He who wears a smile instead of worrying is always the strongest."
"Don’t open a shop unless you like to smile."
"Life is short but a smile takes barely a second."
"Who bathes his hands in blood will have to wash them with tears."
"Too many hands will row the boat up a mountain."
"There is no point in offering a helping hand to someone who wants to drown."
"I pointed out the stars and moon to you, but all you saw was the tip of my finger!"
"The eyes can do a thousand things that the fingers can’t."
"One finger can’t lift a pebble."
"We run away all the time to avoid corning face to face with ourselves."
"A smile on the face is a sign that the heart is at home."
"Your face could stop a clock"
"If you fall in love let her be a beauty; if you should steal, let it be a camel."
"To have beautiful servant girls is a threat to good marriages."
"Even the devil is beautiful when he is young."
"Paid workmen have no arms."
"The thrower of stones throws away the strength of his own arm."
"Keep your broken arm inside your sleeve."
"Gray hair is a sign of age, not of wisdom."
"Age is the price of wisdom."
"It is easy to govern a kingdom but difficult to rule one’s family."
"It is easy to die — the difficulty lies in living."
"The main road is an easy way, but everyone loves the side streets."
"You go out for wool but come back shorn."
"A mule who goes in search of a fine set of antlers, will come back with his ears cut off"
"He who goes to the blacksmith’s shop comes home with scorched clothes."
"If an ass goes traveling it will not come home a horse."
"Spring is sooner recognized by plants than by men."
"No sooner have you spoken than what you have said becomes the property of another."
"That which everybody guards will soon disappear."
"It is easier to wage war with wise enemies than be at peace with foolish friends."
"The heart of a fool is in his mouth and the mouth of the wise man is in his heart."
"The fool does what he can’t avoid, the wise man avoids what he can’t do."
"Hard heads suffer much."
"Life is like perpetual drunkenness, the pleasure passes but the headache remains."
"A crown is no cure for the headache."
"The comforter’s head never aches."
"The bigger a man’s head, the worse his headache."
"You never get a headache from winning."
"When the head does not work, the legs suffer."
"He who does as he likes has no headache."
"He who comforts never has a headache."
"No diadem can cure a headache."
"A person with a wound on his head keeps touching it."
"When you go to bed with a clear head, you will not get up with a headache."
"A pain in the foot is soon forgotten — a pain in the head is not."
"Small children give you headache; big children heartache."
"When you cook a guinea fowl, the partridge gets a headache."
"When the head is sick the whole body is sick."
"The lack of gold only a headache."
"Every head has its own headache."
"You don’t get a headache from what other people have drunk."
"The beginning of health is sleep."
"Work is half of health."
"Good health and good sense are two great blessings."
"An imaginary ailment is worse than a disease."
"Just because you’re not sick doesn’t mean you’re healthy."
"He who takes medicine and neglects to diet wastes the skill of his doctors."
"The beginning of health is to know the disease."
"If you would live healthy, be old early."
"Fresh air impoverishes the doctor."
"He who has health has hope; and he who has hope has everything."
"The healthy die first."
"When the heart is at ease, the body is healthy."
"From the bitterness of disease man learns the sweetness of health."
"One day in perfect health is a lot."
"One who eats plain food is healthy."
"When the head aches, all the body is the worse."
"Joyfulness is half your health."
"Good health is the sister of beauty."
"If you want to live long, be healthy and fat, drink like a dog and eat like a cat."
"Diseases come a horsebacke, and returne on foot."
"He who has no health has nothing."
"Your health comes first — you can always hang yourself later."
"A healthy soul cannot live in a dry body."
"Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise."
"Better a healthy donkey than a consumptive philosopher."
"The tiredness of the body is the health of the soul."
"A good laugh and a long sleep are the best cures in the doctor’s book."
"Health is better than wealth."
"The rich have medicines the poor have health."
"Cowardly men, healthy bones."
"As the person who has health is young, so the person who owes nothing is rich."
"We are usually the best men when in the worst health."
"Sometimes the body becomes healthy by being very sick."
"He who enjoys good health is rich, though he knows it not."
"A good wife and health are a man’s best wealth."
"Health comes before making a livelihood."
"Limit your desires and you will improve your health."
"No time for your health today, will result in no health for your time tomorrow."
"Keep your eye on the ball and your head in the game."
"It is a bad game where nobody wins."
"The poor man and the rich man do not play together."
"He who leaves the game, loses."
"The ball always looks for the best player."
"In the game no one is brother to others."
"Play alone and you’re bound to win."
"The one who wins plays best."
"If you must play, decide upon three things at the start: the rules of the game, the stakes, and the quitting time."
"People will ignore their misfortunes and their interests when they are in competition with their pleasures."
"What is sport to the cat is death to the mouse."
"By the time the fool has learned the game, the players have dispersed."
"In a game it’s difficult to know when to stop."
"The eyes are the window of the soul."
"The eye is blind if the mind is absent."
"Away from the eye, away from the mind."
"The one-eyed man thanks God only when he sees a man blind in both eyes."
"What the eye does not admire the heart does not desire."
"Present to the eye, present to the mind."
"He who doesn’t open his eyes when he buys must still open his purse to pay."
"Beauty is the eye’s food but the soul’s sorrow."
"Onions, smoke and women bring tears to your eyes."
"If you close one eye, you will not hear everything."
"Blue eyes say, Love me or I die; black eyes say, Love me or I kill thee."
"Among the blind the one eyed is king."
"Only through the eyes of others can we really see our own faults."
"Every eye has its look."
"Let him speak who has seen with his eyes."
"What you don’t see with your eyes, don’t invent with your mouth."
"A man’s eyes are for seeing, a woman’s for being seen."
"The tongue can paint what the eye can’t see."
"Happiness opens the arms and closes the eyes."
"Even the one-eyed man winks to women."
"The eyes have one language everywhere."
"He who can read and write has four eyes."
"It is better to trust the eyes rather than the ears."
"When the ear does not hear the eye will see better."
"Who has only one eye must take good care of it."
"Tears come more often from the eyes than from the heart."
"The eyes believe themselves; the ears believe other people."
"Give a blind man eyes and he will ask for eyebrows."
"One eye is a better witness than two ears."
"A rich widow weeps in one eye and laughs with the other."
"Nothing but a handful of dust will fill the eyes of man."
"The eye is the one that eats."
"The eyes see everything but themselves."
"Ten tongues that spread the word are worth less than two eyes that have seen, and two eyes that have seen are worth less than one hand that feels."
"The eye of the master does more than his two hands."
"The eyes are of little use if the mind be blind."
"What the eye sees not, the heart craves not."
"The first love letters are written with the eyes."
"One may have good eyes and see nothing."
"A tear in the eye is the wound of the heart."
"The eyes are bigger than the belly."
"A friend’s eye is a good mirror."
"Loving with the eyes only, has blinded a lot of fools."
"What fills the eye fills the heart."
"The buyer needs a hundred eyes; the seller but one."
"The eye that sees all things else, sees not itself."
"The eye sees, but the hand can’t reach."
"The blind say that eyes have no sense of smell."
"To have two eyes can be cause for pride; but to have one eye is better than to have none."
"Blind eyes see better than blind hearts."
"Do not buy with your ears but with your eyes."
"The best mirror is a friend’s eye."
"No better witnesses than your own eyes."
"He who knows his heart mistrusts his eyes."
"The stranger has big eyes but he doesn’t see anything."
"The eye never forgets what the heart has seen."
"Choose a wife rather by your ear than by your eye."
"It is easier to fill twenty bellies than one pair of eyes."
"The eyes do not see what the mind does not want."
"Good eyes don’t fear smoke."
"Whoever has no children has no light in his eyes."
"Fields have eyes and woods have ears."
"Keep your mouth shut and your eyes open."
"Eyes trust themselves, ears trust others."
"If you feed the mouth, the eye becomes shy."
"Choose a friend with the eyes of an old man, and a horse with the eyes of a young one."
"The eye cannot rise above the eyebrow."
"If you open the eyes of a blind man he wants to go back to the darkness."
"The eyes of all cheats are full of tears."
"If you don’t want to be deceived, you must have as many eyes as hairs on the head."
"An eye and a friend are quickly hurt."
"What the heart doesn’t see, the eye will not see either."
"God grant us no neighbor with two eyes."
"Love is an eye that doesn’t see anything."
"A woman who likes to wash will find water."
"If each person would sweep before his own house, the city would soon be clean."
"Only your real friends will tell you when your face is dirty."
"If you try to cleanse others — just like soap, you will waste away in the process! "
"Happiness spring – cleans the heart."
"A new broom sweeps clean, but an old broom knows the corners."
"The world is our house. Keep it clean."
"The poor are excused from washing with soap."
"If you have escaped the jaws of the crocodile while bathing in the river, you will surely meet a leopard on the way."
"It is at home, not in public, that one washes his dirty linen."
"Two is good, one alone cannot wash his back."
"He who does not regularly put on clean socks will never get used to circus life."
"Bathe other people’s children but don’t wash behind their ears."
"It will all come right in the wash."
"Even though chickens don’t wash, their eggs are still white."
"Cast no dirt into the well that gives you water."
"Do not bathe if there is no water."
"The remedy for dirt is soap and water. The remedy for dying is living."
"A bath refreshes the body, tea refreshes the mind."
"Dirty water cannot be washed."
"If a child washes his hands he could eat with kings."
"Don’t even take a bath with fools, because they’ll throw away the soap."
"Wash your hands in the flowing Ganges."
"Don’t throw away dirty water before you have more clean water."
"If the bathroom and a brandy cannot help a man, then death is imminent."
"You can wash your body but not your soul."
"A dirty soul can be cleansed when one speaks."
"A fool will jump into the bath and forget to wash his face."
"Frequent washing makes not the crow whiter."
"Flowing water never gets dirty."
"No one knows what the dinner was after the plates have been washed."
"Reproaches are the soap of the heart."
"When your enemies attack, bathe in their blood."
"Don’t dirty the place where you have eaten."
"Smack a tray of water and you get to wash your face."
"The monkey will never wash with the same water twice."
"Blood cannot be washed out with blood."
"If you are going to bathe, get thoroughly wet."
"Indecision is like the stepchild: If he doesn’t wash his hands, he is called dirty; if he does, he is wasting water."
"A lot will stick to dirty hands."
"An old broom knows the dirty corners best."
"Repentant tears wash out the stain of guilt."
"You will never drown where you always take a bath."
"Weeping washes the face."
"If you want to sweep the steps clean, start at the top."
"The night rinses what the day has soaped."
"Salt water and absence wash away love."
"Clean bodies, pure morals."
"Better to wash an old kimono than borrow a new one."
"Wash your hands often, your feet seldom, and your head never."
"Who cleans up the dirt washes away happiness."
"What soap is for the body, tears are for the soul."
"Who bathes his hands in blood will have to wash them with tears."
"If you want to be dead, wash your head and go to bed."
"When one hand washes another, both become clean."
"Clean your own yard first before asking others to clean theirs."
"Who takes the child by the hand, takes the mother by the heart."
"The children eat the fruit and the father sleeps on the peel."
"You can do anything with children if you only play with them."
"A child without a mother is like a fish in shallow water."
"Children are buttonholes that hold their parents together."
"The ones that matter the most are the children."
"Bricks and mortar make a house, but the laughter of children make a home."
"There’s only one pretty child in the world, and every mother has it."
"What the child says, he has heard at home."
"To understand your parents’ love you must raise children yourself."
"Children have more need of models than critics."
"Children will tell you what they do, men what they think and older people what they have seen and heard."
"He who has children will never die of starvation."
"Bad children? Guilty parents! "
"When God gives a child, he also gives the clothing."
"Small children won’t let you sleep, bigger children won’t let you live."
"One father can feed seven children, but seven children cannot feed one father."
"Children have a hair of their father."
"He who has a lot of money and no children is not rich; he who has many children and no money is not a pauper."
"Children are the reward of life."
"Children are a poor man’s wealth."
"What children hear their parents say by the fireside, they repeat in the highway."
"Even children of the same mother look different."
"The child who loves freedom is the first victim of it."
