"Whoever has no children has no light in his eyes."
"Don’t give a child a name until after it is born."
"If you want your children to have a peaceful life, let them suffer a little hunger and a little coldness."
"Small children give you headache; big children heartache."
"The child hates the one who gives him all he wants."
"Better a snotty child than his nose wiped off."
"Children grow up, with or without parents."
"A truly great man never puts away the simplicity of a child."
"The jewel of the air is the sun; the jewel of the house is the child."
"Children’s love is like water in a basket."
"With a child in the house, all corners all full."
"A rich child often sits in a poor mother’s lap."
"Children suck the mother when they are young and the father when they are old."
"Late children are early orphans."
"Each child brings his own blessing into the world."
"Give your children too much freedom and you lose your own."
"Do not confine your children to your own learning, for they were born in another time."
"When a rich man wants children, he gets dollars, when a poor man wants dollars, he gets children."
"When you have children yourself, you begin to understand what you owe your parents."
"A house without a dog, a cat, or a little child is a house without joy or laughter."
"More precious than our children are the children of our children."
"The adult looks to deeds, the child to love."
"A child is a bridge to heaven."
"Children who get everything they ask for seldom succeed in life."
"When the child falls the mother weeps; when the mother falls the child laughs."
"Better the child cry, than the mother sigh."
"Sickness accompanies a waning moon; a new moon cures disease."
"He that eats till he is sick must fast till he is well."
"When a poor man eats a chicken, one or the other is sick."
"Time cures the sick man, not the ointment."
"People live with their own idiosyncrasies and die of their own illnesses."
"Sickness comes in like a horse and leaves like a snail."
"The sickness of the body is the cure of the mind."
"Fear and restlessness kill more than do illnesses."
"There is no cure for him who hides an illness."
"When the head is sick the whole body is sick."
"He who is sick will not refuse medicine."
"If the hyena eats the sick man, he will eat the whole one."
"Sickness shows us what we are."
"There is an herb for every kind of sickness but not for death."
"There is no cure for an unknown illness."
"Sick people have no friends."
"If two doctors visit a sick man, the sexton rings the bells."
"If you want to give a sick man medicine, let him first be really ill — so that he can see how well the medicine works."
"You inherit from the dead, not from the sick."
"Better a sick body than an ignorant mind."
"Tobacco hic, Will make a man well if he be sick."
"Time, not medicine, cures the sick."
"Keep your sickness until Friday and don’t fast."
"Sometimes the body becomes healthy by being very sick."
"Youth is a kind of illness cured only by the passing years."
"He wanted to cure a healthy pig and ended up with a sick one."
"To a physician a sick man is a garden."
"Sickness soaks the purse."
"Sickness comes on horseback, but goes away on foot."
"One who recovers from sickness, forgets about God."
"Too much prudishness makes the lover sick."
"If you are too smart to pay the doctor, you had better be too smart to get ill."
"No man is a good physician who has never been sick."
"The superior doctor prevents sickness; the mediocre doctor attends to impending sickness; the inferior doctor treats actual sickness."
"When a liar speaks the truth, he is sick."
"Every sickness begins in the stomach."
"Sick people are like kings."
"Sickly women live longer."
"Man is the instrument of illness."
"A sick person is a prisoner."
"Sickness is felt, but health not at all."
"If love is a sickness, patience is the remedy."
"It’s better to drink and feel sick than not to drink and feel bad."
"A healthy ear can stand hearing sick words."
"If you are sick, think about your life; if you are better, think about your gold."
"One can get sick of cake, but never of bread."
"If envy were a fever, all the world would be ill."
"Sickness comes with a waning moon; a new moon cures disease."
"You won’t get sick if you have plenty of work."
"Just as a medicine may not cure a serious illness, wine will certainly not dispel your grief."
"When you are sick you promise a goat, but when you are well again make do with a chicken."
"If you sit at a crossroads, you will get sick."
"Happy is the man without sickness. Rich is the man with no debts."
"Day has its eyes, night has its ears."
"Never praise life in front of death, nor the beautiful day in front of night."
"Last night I made a thousand plans, but this morning I went my old way."
"A man is old when he takes the whole night to do what he used to do all night long."
"The night rinses what the day has soaped."
"Do not blame the sun for the darkness of the night."
"Clear conscience never fears midnight knocking."
"The nights are short for him who married late in life."
"The night walks the same road as the dream."
"Midsummer night is not long but it sets many cradles rocking."
"It is never later than midnight."
"Red sky at night, sailor’s delight. Red sky at morning, sailors take warning."
"The darkness of night cannot stop the light of morning."
"The night is the king of the shadows."
"Who arrives in the darkness departs as night falls."
"Nights of pleasure are short."
"If there are no nightingales one must settle for owls."
"One night with an ugly woman and one day in the mountains both are like an eternity."
"He who led me in the night, will be thanked by me at daybreak."
"He who does not lose his way by night will not lose his way by day."
"The gates of hell are always open, even at midnight."
"When night falls the face of the wolf lights up."
"A decision made at night may be changed in the morning."
"Darkness and night are mothers of thought."
"The day will wipe out all the promises of the night."
"Many seek good nights and waste good days."
"Better to sit all night than to go to bed with a dragon."
"To spend the night in anger is better than to spend it repenting."
"If you carry treasure, don’t travel at night."
"If you go out a lot at night, you will probably meet ghosts."
"You can make the dream bigger than the night."
"The day did not know that night had fallen."
"Night is the mother of advice."
"No matter how long the night, the day is sure to come."
"For a bad night, a mattress of wine."
"Better a night full of anger than a night full of repentance."
"The loss of one night’s sleep is followed by ten days of inconvenience."
"Boast during the day; be humble at night."
"Curse your wife at evening, sleep alone at night."
"An army of deer would be more formidable commanded by a lion, than a an army of lions commanded by a stag."
"Caution is not cowardice; even the ants march armed."
"An army of sheep led by a lion would defeat an army of lions led by a sheep."
"With water make rivers, with rice make armies."
"If you don’t have a brain, join the army; if you don’t have rice, use beans instead."
"An army is driven back by courage and not by insults, however many."
"The army is the poison and the people are the water in which the poison is mixed."
"Even the largest army is nothing without a good general."
"Truth may walk through the world unarmed."
"Where the army goes there is no grass."
"A great war leaves the country with three armies — an army of cripples, an army of mourners, and an army of thieves."
"Where there are no dogs the wolves will howl."
"When the healthy dog fights with a mad dog, it is the ears of the healthy one that are bitten off."
"The dog has four feet, but he does not walk in four roads at the same time."
"A dog with a docked tail is not afraid that its backside can be seen."
"If you don’t want to be hung yourself, blame the dog for stealing the sausage."
"A hungry wolf is stronger than a satisfied dog."
"Stroke the dog and he will mark you with his dirty paws."
"A grateful dog has more worth than an ungrateful man."
"By slitting the ears and cutting the tail, a dog is still a dog, not a horse, not an ass."
"A white dog does not bite another white dog."
"When the hyena is gone, the dog begins to bark."
"The talker will lead the dog to the meat market."
"A garden without a fence is like a dog without a tail."
"The barking of a dog does not disturb the man on a camel."
""Almost a hit," said the boy as he threw the stone at his dog and hit his stepmother’s leg."
"Who loves me loves my dog."
"To a dog a bone has more value than a pearl."
"One dog barks at something, the rest bark at him."
"Do not call to a dog with a whip in your hand."
"The dog barks, the pig eats."
"The good dog never gets a good bone."
"The dogs bark, but the caravan moves on."
"An old lion will be mocked by the dogs."
"The dog’s tail stays crooked even if he is buried for twelve years."
"Beware of a man that does not talk and a dog that does not bark."
"A dog with a bone is always in danger."
"The best thing about a man is his dog."
"If you must be a servant, serve the rich; if you must be a dog, let it be a temple dog."
"The wolf and the dog agree about the goat — which together they eat."
"Even good dogs have fleas."
"He who is dependant on others must make friends with the dog."
"A dog shows affection even to a poor family."
"A dog that barks all the time gets little attention."
"A dog that barks much is never a good hunter."
"No good dog barks without reason."
"When a dog has money, he buys cheese."
"Only thin dogs become wild."
"Every dog knows his dinnertime."
"No flock without dog and shepherd."
"Only mad dogs and Englishmen go out in the noonday sun."
"Don’t kick a sleeping dog."
"The stick that breaks the window does not kill a dog."
"There is no ivory in the mouth of a dog."
"The dog’s tail, even if buried for twelve years, will remain as crooked as ever."
"The dog is a lion in his own house."
"The dog that wags its tail won’t be beaten."
"If you turn into a dog, be sure to choose a rich family."
"It’s the grinding of his teeth that awakes the blacksmith’s dog, not the noise of the hammer."
"The dog’s kennel is not the place to keep a sausage."
"The most noble dog can only bark."
"Better to be a dog in peacetime that a man in wartime."
"If a monkey is amongst dogs, why won’t it start barking."
"A living dog is better than a dead lion."
"If the tail of the dog can save me, I don’t care about its stench."
"Barking dogs don’t bite."
"It’s not the fleas of the dog that make the cat meow."
"An honest man does not make himself a dog for the sake of a bone."
"The moon does not care if the dog barks at it."
"Three things it is best to avoid: a strange dog, a flood, and a man who thinks he is wise."
"If you want to live long, be healthy and fat, drink like a dog and eat like a cat."
"A dog always bites under the knee."
"A dog returns to where he has been fed."
"If you do not step on the dog’s tail, he will not bite you."
"Even a dog will not eat a leg without flesh."
"Better have a dog for your friend than your enemy."
"A dog cannot carry its puppies on its back."
"Never throw the cat at the dog."
"A tailless dog cannot express his joy."
"Beware of silent dogs and still waters."
"When a dog bites you, do not bite back."
"A hungry dog will eat his own excrement."
"The dog’s bark is not might but fright."
"Expect trust from a dog but not from a woman."
"I would rather have a dog as a friend than an enemy."
"If I had a dog as daft, I would shoot him."
"Watch out for the dog that doesn’t bark and the man who says nothing."
"The old dog barks while he is sitting down."
"If you are married to a chicken obey the chicken. If you are married to a dog obey the dog."
"The dog says: "Master, my life is far too good, hurt me in the tail." "
"Children aren’t dogs; adults aren’t gods."
"Better to be a free dog than a caged lion."
"The more hair a dog has, the more fleas he will have."
"The dog wags his tail, not for you, but for your bread."
"When the dog is down, everyone is ready to bite him."
"The dogs may bark but the caravan moves on."
"Those who sleep with dogs will rise with fleas."
"A dog does not mind being called a dog."
"The fool sings a love song to his wife, the wise man will talk about his dog."
"Timid dogs bark most."
"The worst kind of dog is the one who does not want to bite."
"The dog will always attack the one with torn trousers."
"For every dog there is an appropriate stick."
"A good man, but his mad dog won’t let you speak to him."
"A river is not contaminated by having a dog drink from it."
"The barking dog gives you no power — it gives you fear."
"Dogs that fight each other will join forces against the wolf."
"It’s difficult to chain up an old dog."
"A biting dog does not bark."
"A dog is a man’s best friend."
"Every dog is allowed one bite."
"Nobles and dogs leave the door open."
"Do not show a stick to a dog that has been beaten."
"As the dog said, "If I fall down for you and you fall down for me, it is playing." "
"Conscience is the dog that can’t bite, but never stops barking."
"In a place without dogs they teach the cats to bark."
"Dogs don’t love people, they love the place where they are fed."
"When the poor man sets a trap only his dog gets caught."
"Do not respond to a barking dog."
"A good dog deserves a good bone."
"It is up to the people to feed the dogs; it’s up to the Cardias to feed the Turks."
"My dog slaps you with his tail and bites you with his teeth."
"The dog that quits barking can get some sleep."
"Two dogs strive for a bone and the third one runs off with it."
"The skinnier the dog, the more fleas he has."
"You can hate the dog, but do not tell him that his teeth are dirty."
"Every dog has his day."
"If a man becomes powerful even his chicken and his dog go to heaven."
"The dog that trots about finds a bone."
"All are not thieves that dogs bark at."
"Lie down with dogs, wake up with fleas."
"Why keep a dog and bark yourself? "
"Beware a rickety wall, a savage dog, and a quarrelsome person."
"He who rides a camel should not be afraid of dogs."
"An honest man is not the worse because a dog barks at him."
"A dog with a bone knows no friend."
"The world is like carrion; those who love and eat from it are dogs."
"The wolf is not afraid of the dog, but he doesn’t like the sound of his barking."
"Take a hair of the dog that bit you."
"The silent dog is the first to bite."
"The dog that is going to bite does not show its teeth."
"Your dog wishes you a long life."
"Where there is a bone, there are dogs."
"When the wolf invites you in, you had better take your dog."
"A hundred men can sit together quietly but when two dogs get together there will be a fight."
"For his master the dog is a lion."
"A dog won’t bite you if you are carrying a stick."
"One dog barks at something specific, and a hundred bark at the sound."
"Women and cats in the house, men and dogs in the street."
"The dog learns to swim when the water reaches his ears."
"There are three faithful friends: an old wife, an old dog, and ready money."
"The dog called "Sorrow," without eating, will be fat in every house."
"A dog will not make himself look like a horse just by cutting off his tail."
"The dog’s kennel is no place to keep a sausage."
"He who does not feed the dog feeds the thief."
"If a flea had money, it would buy its own dog."
"Money makes even dogs dance."
"Even a weak lion is not bitten by a dog."
"Dog does not eat dog."
"Theologians, dogs, and singers always disagree."
"The unfortunate would be bitten by toothless dogs."
"He who gossips and he who listens to it deserve to be thrown to the dogs."
"He who wants to talk with the dogs must learn to bark."
"The man who has mounted an elephant will not fear the bark of a dog."
"A dog won’t forsake his master because of poverty; a son never deserts his mother because of her homely appearance."
"The dog I bought, bit me; the fire I kindled burned me."
"Every dog is a lion at home."
"You cannot tie up a dog with a chain of sausages."
"Those who sleep with dogs gets up with fleas."
"When the hyena drinks, the dog can only look on."
"An old dog will learn no tricks."
"Once a man has been bitten by a lion, he buys a dog."
"You can’t teach an old dog new tricks."
"At twenty a man will be a peacock, at thirty a lion, at forty a camel, at fifty a serpent, at sixty a dog, at seventy a monkey, and at eighty nothing."
"Too many calls confuse the dog."
"A dog never forgets his master."
"Be on your guard against a silent dog and still water."
"A dog does not flee from a bone."
"Beware of the dog that does not bark."
"Dogs that always fight always have bleeding ears."
"Stroke your dog, and he’ll spoil your clothes."
"He who has a dog need not bark himself."
"It is the wandering dog that finds the old bone."
"A bachelor and a dog can do anything."
"A hungry dog will bring a lion down."
"Relatives are the worst friends, said the fox as the dogs took after him."
"He who wants to kill a dog says that he has urinated against the mosque."
"Stroke your dog and he will steal eggs."
"Let sleeping dogs lie."
"If you stop every time a dog barks, your road will never end."
"If you are a host to your guest, be a host to his dog also."
"If you owe a dog anything, call him "sir." "
"A dog in a kennel barks at his fleas — a hunting dog does not feel them."
"So long as the wolf is captured the dog will bite his leg."
"Before you beat the dog, find out the name of his master."
"If no one comes the dog does not bark."
"An old dog does not bark in vain."
"The fatter the flea the leaner the dog."
"Be careful for deep water and dogs that do not bark."
"If the dog leads the man, the man is blind. If the man leads the dog, the man is married."
"Every dog is a tiger in his own street."
"When there is real danger, the dogs don’t bark."
"The gypsy church was made of pork and the dogs ate it."
"Give a dog a bad name and hang him."
"A dog will always be a dog, even if he is raised by lions."
"Better a living dog than a dead lion."
"Barking dogs seldom bite."
"A dog doesn’t like bananas, but he can’t bear to think that chickens eat them."
"If you hit my dog you hit myself."
"Barking dogs don’t catch hares."
"How can you expect to find ivory in a dog’s mouth? "
"In the long run even a dog will compromise with the cat."
"Every dog is a great barker at the door of his own house."
"A good dog does not bite a chicken and a good man does not hit his wife."
"If a dog bites you and you don’t bite him back, it will say that you have no teeth."
"The urine of one dog will not pollute the ocean."
"Love me, love my dog."
"If the dog barks, go in; if the bitch barks you had better stay outside."
"Give a dog a tasty name and eat him."
"If a dog’s prayers were answered, bones would rain from the skies."
"A dog with many masters, dies of starvation."
"Dust does not rise because a dog-flea hops."
"The loudest bark rids not a dog of his fleas."
"Dogs cannot make dreams come true — people must do that."
"The barking of the dogs will not disturb the clouds."
"If you’re out to beat a dog, you’re sure to find a stick."
"The barking of dogs does not reach heaven."
"The greatest love is a mother’s; then a dog’s; then a sweetheart’s."
"You can’t kill a dog just to save a cat’s tail."
"You don’t need a dog to catch a lame hare."
"Two dogs can kill a lion."
"When money is stolen you can only beat the dog."
"Many dogs kill a hare, no matter how many turns it makes."
"Behind the dog it is "dog," in front of it, it’s "mister dog." "
"Beware of still water, a still dog, and a still enemy."
"If a dog offers to help you across the river, don’t ask if he is suffering from the mange."
"If the dog is not at home, he barks not."
"The wolf is not afraid of the sheepdog, but he is of his chain."
"Beat one dog and the others will run away."
"A dog by your side is better than a brother miles away."
"There are more chains than mad dogs."
"At high tide fish eat ants; at low tide ants eat fish."
"Different fields, different grasshoppers; different seas, different fish."
"A child without a mother is like a fish in shallow water."
"Look and keep silent, and if you are eating meat, tell the world it’s fish."
"The bigger the river the bigger the fish."
"If you are not a fish, how can you know if the fish are happy? "
"Eat your fish while it is still fresh and marry the girl while she is still young."
"May the holes in your net be no larger than the fish in it."
"Women and fishes are best in the middle."
"Big fish eat little fish."
"A cat loves fish, but won’t risk its claws."
"Who owns the bank owns the fish."
"A rotting fish begins to stink at the head."
"From all the fish in the pot you can only make one soup."
"To lie and eat fish demand a lot of skill."
"Nothing is so clean as a fish."
"All rotten fish taste the same."
"Tasty fish have to swim three times: once in the water, then in butter, and finally in wine."
"There is no need for fish in an empty pond."
"Who hears the fishes when they cry? "
"Weaving a net is better than praying for fish at the edge of the water."
"If you find no fish, you have to eat bread."
"To climb a tree to catch a fish is talking much and doing nothing."
"It is not a fish until it is on the bank."
"Men eat fish — thanks to the sauce."
"When asked, "What news from the sea?" The fish replied "I have a lot to say, but my mouth is full of water." "
"A fish gets bigger when it gets away."
"Big fish jump out of the kettle."
"When you are crossing over a river you might be eaten by crocodiles, but don’t let yourself get bitten by the little fish."
"Throw a lucky man in the sea, and he will come up with a fish in his mouth."
"A rotten fish pollutes the whole kitchen."
"It is the sauce that makes the fish edible."
"Little fish are sweet."
"When the big fish fight the shrimps must lie low."
"Fish and guests stink after three days."
"A cat likes to eat fresh fish but it will not go into the water."
"Water can do without fish, fish cannot do without water."
"Venture a small fish to catch a much greater one."
"Where there is fish, there is water."
"No matter how hard you throw a dead fish in the water, it still won’t swim."
"In still waters are the largest fish."
"A fish wouldn’t get into trouble if it kept its mouth shut."
"Govern a family as you would cook a small fish — very gently."
"As long as the fish swims in the water, don’t light up the grill."
"There is a time to fish and a time to prepare the fish."
"If you are planning for a year, sow rice; if you are planning for a decade, plant trees; if you are planning for a lifetime, educate people."
"Love is like young rice: transplanted, still it grows."
"Sorrow is like rice in an attic: you use a little every day and at the end it is all gone."
"Growing rice gives you more than poetry will."
"Laugh at the rice and you will weep for the lentil."
"Women are like raindrops: some fall on palaces, others on rice fields."
"Don’t trust a hungry man to watch your rice."
"Ants can attack with a grain of rice."
"A pig used to dirt turns its nose up at rice."
"The bigger the pot the more rice will stick to it."
"You can’t get rice by pounding bran."
"Cold tea and cold rice are tolerable; cold looks and cold words aren’t."
"Better than a banquet somewhere else is a good cup of tea and a bowl of rice at home."
"With water make rivers, with rice make armies."
"If you plant grass, you won’t get rice."
"Sun is for cucumbers, rain for rice."
"Without rice, even the cleverest housewife cannot cook."
"Even the most resourceful housewife cannot create miracles from rice less pantry."
"He that has no money might as well be buried in a rice tub with his mouth sewn up."
"Luck is like having a rice dumpling fly into your mouth."
"Once the rice is pudding, it’s too late to reclaim the rice."
"If you don’t have a brain, join the army; if you don’t have rice, use beans instead."
"Rice is born in water and must die in wine."
"Plant rice when the ground is ready; pursue women when you feel passion."
"Apple blossoms are beautiful, but rice dumplings are better."
"Talking doesn’t get your rice cooked."
"A teacher is someone who ploughs with his tongue to fill his little bowl with rice."
"When the curry is tasty, the rice is hard."
"Sweet rice is eaten quickly."
"To be uncertain is to be uncomfortable, but to be certain is to be ridiculous."
"The first drink makes you a frisky gazelle, the second an impetuous zebra, the third a roaring lion, and with the fourth you become a silly donkey."
"A silly daughter teaches her mother how to bear children."
"Joyfulness is half your health. "
"Peace is the well from which the stream of joy runs."
"A joy that’s shared is a joy made double. "
"A wise teacher makes learning a joy."
"Don’t promise something when you are full of joy; don’t answer letters when you are full of anger."
"Every joy will follow in grief’s footsteps."
"Friendship doubles joy and halves grief. "
"Half of an orange tastes just as sweet as a whole one. "
"Hidden joy is an extinguished candle."
"If you get rich, be in a dark corner when you jump for joy."
"If you’re skilled, your wallet will be filled. "
"In the midst of great joy do not promise to give a man anything; in the midst of great anger do not answer a man’s letter. "
"Into the house where joy lives, happiness will gladly come."
"Joy and sorrow sleep in the same bed."
"Life itself cannot give you joy, unless you really will it. Life just gives you time and space; it’s up to you to fill it. "
"Never trust the man who tells you all his troubles but keeps from you all his joys."
"No joy without wine."
"Nothing equals the joy of the drinker, except the joy of the wine in being drunk. "
"Of no worldly good can the joy be perfect, unless it is shared by a friend. "
"Old age is not a joy, but death is not a gain. "
"One does not live on joy or die of sorrow."
"One joy scatters a hundred grieve. "
"Shared joy is a double joy; shared sorrow is half a sorrow."
"Sorrow doesn’t kill — reckless joy does."
"Sorrow is the child of too much joy."
"The body of joy is not so big."
"The bridge between joy and sorrow is not long. "
"The fear of death takes away the joy of living. "
"The heir’s tears are but a mask to disguise his joy."
"The joy of a poor man does not last long. "
"The less souls, the more joy."

category: to be totally at leisure for one day is to be immortal for one day. ~chinese

text: "To long for everything: sorrow; to accept everything: joy."
"One must bless the new moon when it is visible in the sky."
"Nothing so visible than what you want to hide."
"Women do not drink liquor, but it disappears when they are present."
"Who has ever seen tomorrow?"
"Where wine appears the doctor disappears."
"When you’ve heard it you must see it; when you’ve seen it make a judgment with your heart."
"When the water fall the stone becomes visible."
"What worth has beauty if it is not seen?"
"Wealth diminishes with usage; learning increases with use."
"Two eyes that have seen are worth less than one hand that feels."
"Those in a high position can be seen from far away."

category: the loveliest of faces are to be seen by moonlight, when one sees half with the eye and half with the fancy. ~iranian"

text: "The horizon will not disappear as you run towards it."
"The eye never forgets what the heart has seen."
"The dead are not seen in the company of the living."
"The daughter-in-law wipes away what the mother-in-law has seen."

category: that which everybody guards will soon disappear. ~polish"

text: "Promises are like the full moon: if they are not kept at once they diminish day by day."
"One cannot ski so softly that the tracks cannot be seen."
"Old soldiers never die, they simply fade away."
"Old countries don’t disappear overnight; they stay for breakfast."
"Lovely flowers fade fast."
"Knowledge that is not replenished diminishes every day."
"In thevisiblechurch the true Christians are invisible."
"If you think about things too long, good thoughts will disappear."
"If you fail to practice your art, it will soon disappear."
"If i am seen i am joking; if i am not seen i steal."
"I know nothing about it, i haven’t seen it; that is the best answer."
"He who has come through the fire will fade in the sun."
"What is bad luck for one man is good luck for another."
"Change yourself, and your luck will change."
"Luck is loaned, not owned."
"Luck that lasts is always suspected."
"Luck sometimes visits a fool, but never sits down with him."
"You have to take it as it happens, but you should try to make it happen the way you want to take it."
"You don’t need intelligence to have luck, but you do need luck to have intelligence."
"You can give a piece of advice, but not good luck along with that."
"When your luck deserts you, even cold food burns."
"When luck joins in the game, cleverness scores double."
"When ill luck falls asleep, let none wake her."
"When God throws the dice, they are loaded."
"To wait for luck is the same as waiting for death."
"To be lucky you need a little wit."
"Throw a lucky man in the sea, and he will come up with a fish in his mouth."
"Third time lucky."
"There is no one luckier than he who thinks himself so."
"There is no luck except where there is discipline."
"The person afraid of bad luck will never know good."
"The more you know, the luckier you get."
"The lucky fellow loses his wife; the unlucky fellow loses his horse."
"The luckiest dies in his cradle."
"The luck of idle men sits next to them."
"The day you decide to do it is your lucky day."
"Substance is not enough, accident is also required."
"Seven trades but no luck."
"See a pin and pick it up, all the day you’ll have good luck; see a pin and let it lie, you’ll want a pin before you die."
"Parents can give their children everything except good luck."
"One ounce of good luck is better than a ton of brains."
"Nothing falls from heaven."
"Lucky at cards, unlucky in love."
"Luck stops at the door and inquires whether prudence is within."
"Luck seeks those who flee and flees those who seek it."
"Luck never gives; it only lends."
"Luck is the residue of design."
"Luck is the idol of the idle."
"Luck is like having a rice dumpling fly into your mouth."
"Luck is infatuated with the efficient."
"It is better to be born lucky than rich."
"In bad luck, hold out; in good luck, hold in."
"If you were born lucky, even your rooster will lay eggs."
"If you are looking for bad luck, you will soon find it."
"If bad luck is asleep you must not awaken it."
"He that has the luck leads the bride to church."
"Guests bring good luck with them."
"Good luck comes in slender currents, misfortune in a rolling tide."
"Good luck beats early rising."
"Good looking and good luck don’t always walk the same road."
"Go and wake up your luck."
"Fortune is with you for an hour and against you for ten! "
"Each man’s character shapes his fortunes."
"Better an ounce of luck than a pound of gold."
"Bad luck is fertile."
"Bad luck for one man is good luck for another."
"After bad luck comes good fortune."
"A person does not seek luck; luck seeks the person."
"A lucky person is someone who plants pebbles and harvests potatoes."
"Daughters may be seen but not heard."
"A melancholic look is visible but not a melancholic heart."
"A man’s eyes are for seeing, a woman’s for being seen."
"A child is a certain sorrow and uncertain joy. "
"A day of sorrow is longer than a month of joy."
"A house without a dog, a cat, or a little child is a house without joy or laughter."
"What makes us discontented with our condition is the absurdly exaggerated idea we have of the happiness of others."
"Young folk, silly folk; old folk, cold folk."
"Nothing is nobler than politeness, and nothing more ridiculous than ceremony."
"It’s better for people to wait for rice, than rice for people."
"You can live with tea and cold rice but not with cold words."
"Make the amount of sauce you use correspond to the amount of rice you have."
"There is never a fish without a bone, and no man without faults."
"Never offer to teach a fish to swim."
"The pool has dried up, and the fish is in trouble."
"Dogs have teeth in all countries."
"A house without a dog, a cat, or a little child is a house without joy or laughter."
"An old dog can’t get used to chains."
"Two make an army against one."
"Peace lasts until the army comes, and the army lasts until peace comes."
"A word once spoken, an army of chariots cannot overtake it."
"Even the night has ears."
"If the king says that it is night in the middle of the day, look up at the stars."
"Wait until it is night before saying it has been a fine day."
"A man cannot be a good physician if he has never been sick himself."
"It’s better that it should make you sick than that you don’t eat it at all."
"A house without children is a graveyard."
"Hold your children with your heart but teach them with your hands."
"If a man leaves little children behind him, it is as if he did not die."
"Children of the same mother do not always agree."
"You don’t wash blood away with blood but with water."
"Cleanliness is the luxury of the poor."
"One hand washes the other and both wash the face."
"If the eyes didn’t see, the hands wouldn’t take."
"Keep both eyes open before you are married and afterwards close only one."
"Competition is the whetstone of talent."
"What is sport to the boy is the death of the bird."
"Those who play the game do not see as clearly as those who watch."
